steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Stack your feet together and press your heels down into the ground. Lengthen your spine and engage your core.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and bring your foot in front of your left hip
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your foot in front of your left hip. Your right foot should be flat on the ground, with your heel in line with your left hip. Your left leg should be extended straight behind you.

steps.name: Reach your right arm behind you and clasp your left arm
steps.description: Reach your right arm behind you and clasp your left arm, just above the elbow. Use your right hand to pull your left arm towards your back. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your chest open.

steps.name: Turn your torso to the right
steps.description: Turn your torso to the right, bringing your right shoulder towards your left knee. Keep your spine long and your core engaged. Hold for 5-10 breaths.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side, turning to the left.

benefits: Strengthens the core, spine, and back muscles
Improves flexibility in the spine and hips
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the lower back, hips, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Bharadvajasana I
Listen to your body and don't force yourself into the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Stand with feet together, inhale deeply
steps.description: Stand with your feet together and inhale deeply. Ground your feet into the floor and lengthen your spine.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge forward from your hips
steps.description: Exhale and hinge forward from your hips, keeping your legs straight and your spine long. Reach for your toes with your fingertips, keeping your hands open and relaxed.

steps.name: Gently grasp your big toes with your fingers
steps.description: Gently grasp your big toes with your fingers, keeping your hands close to your shins. If you can't reach your toes, grab a strap and loop it around the arch of your foot.

steps.name: Keep your spine long and your gaze down
steps.description: Keep your spine long and your gaze down towards the ground. If your hamstrings are tight, bend your knees slightly to find a comfortable stretch.

steps.name: Hold for 5-10 breaths
steps.description: Hold the pose for 5-10 breaths, breathing deeply and evenly. Focus on lengthening your spine and feeling the stretch in your hamstrings and lower back.

steps.name: Inhale and slowly rise back up to standing
steps.description: Inhale and slowly rise back up to standing, keeping your spine long and your toes pointed. Ground down through your feet as you come up.

benefits: Stretches the hamstring, quads, and groin
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe hip or knee injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Big Toe Pose
Listen to your body and don't force yourself into the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your spine straight and your arms resting alongside your body.

steps.name: Bend your knees and lift your feet off the floor
steps.description: Bend your knees and lift your feet off the floor, so that your shins are parallel to the floor. This is the starting position.

steps.name: Extend your arms forward
steps.description: Extend your arms forward, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing each other. Keep your spine straight and your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Lean back slightly and lift your feet
steps.description: Lean back slightly, balancing on your sitting bones. Lift your feet to bring your lower legs parallel to the floor. If you can, straighten your legs, raising your toes to eye level.

steps.name: Engage your core and open your chest
steps.description: Engage your abdominal muscles to support your spine. Keep your chest open and your shoulders relaxed. Focus on your breath, maintaining the pose for several breaths.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your legs and sit back comfortably. Take a moment to breathe and relax before moving on to the next activity.

benefits: Strengthens the core, abdominal muscles, and back
precautions: Not recommended for people with lower back pain or injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Boat Pose
Listen to your body and don't force yourself into the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a seated position
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Sit up tall, lengthening your spine.

steps.name: Bend your knees and bring your feet together
steps.description: Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together in front of you. Draw your heels as close to your body as comfortable.

steps.name: Hold your feet or ankles
steps.description: Grasp your feet or ankles with your hands. Ensure that your spine remains long and you are not hunching over.

steps.name: Open your knees to the sides
steps.description: Gently open your knees to the sides, lowering them towards the floor. Keep your spine straight and avoid forcing your knees down.

steps.name: Maintain the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Stay in the pose for several deep breaths. With each exhale, try to relax your knees a bit more towards the floor, maintaining a straight spine.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, use your hands to lift your knees and bring your legs back to the starting position. Take a moment to relax and breathe before transitioning to your next activity.

benefits: Opens the hips, inner thighs, groin, and inner ankles
Relieves tension in the lower back and sacrum
Enhances flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent hip or knee injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Bound Angle Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Lie on your stomach
steps.description: Start by lying flat on your stomach, with your legs extended behind you and your arms resting alongside your body. Keep your forehead on the mat.

steps.name: Bend your knees and reach for your ankles
steps.description: Bend your knees and reach back with your hands to hold onto your ankles. Ensure your knees are hip-width apart.

steps.name: Lift your chest and thighs off the mat
steps.description: Inhale and lift your chest and thighs off the mat by pushing your feet against your hands. Keep your head in a neutral position, and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Engage your back muscles
steps.description: Engage your back muscles and keep your shoulder blades pressed against your back. Ensure that the lift comes from your back muscles rather than just pulling with your arms.

steps.name: Hold the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Maintain the pose for a few breaths. With each inhale, lift a bit higher; with each exhale, try to relax into the pose more deeply.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, exhale and gently lower your thighs and chest to the mat. Release your ankles, and lie flat for a few moments before moving to your next pose.

benefits: Stretches the spine, hamstrings, quadriceps, groin, chest, and shoulders
Strengthens the back, arms, and core
Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent back or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Bow Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start by lying on your back
steps.description: Lie on your back on the mat, with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Keep your arms at your sides, palms down. Your feet should be hip-width apart and parallel to each other.

steps.name: Press your feet and arms into the floor
steps.description: Press your feet and arms firmly into the floor. This will be the foundation of the pose.

steps.name: Lift your hips towards the ceiling
steps.description: Exhale and lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a straight line from your shoulders to your knees. Keep your thighs and feet parallel.

steps.name: Clasp your hands under your back
steps.description: If comfortable, clasp your hands together under your back and extend through your arms to help lift your chest up.

steps.name: Engage your glutes and thighs
steps.description: Engage your glutes and thighs to support the lift. Be mindful not to over-clench, keeping the focus on your legs and hips.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, maintaining a steady breathing rhythm. Feel the stretch in your chest, spine, and thighs.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, unclasp your hands and slowly roll your spine back down onto the floor, starting from the upper back to the lower back. Rest for a moment before moving.

benefits: Strengthens the core, back, glutes, and hamstrings
May aid digestion and promote relaxation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back, shoulder, or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Bridge Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Kneel on the floor
steps.description: Begin by kneeling on the floor with your knees hip-width apart and your thighs perpendicular to the floor. Place your hands on your hips, fingers pointing downwards.

steps.name: Arch your back and reach for your heels
steps.description: Press your shins and the tops of your feet into the floor. Gently arch your back and slide your hands down over your buttocks to reach for your heels.

steps.name: Lift your chest towards the ceiling
steps.description: Inhale and lift your chest towards the ceiling, pushing your hips forward to keep your thighs vertical. Tilt your head back, but avoid straining your neck.

steps.name: Deepen the backbend
steps.description: If comfortable, deepen the backbend by pressing your hands firmly against your heels, lifting your chest more, and pushing your hips forward.

steps.name: Hold the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths, focusing on opening your chest and maintaining a smooth, even breath.

steps.name: Exit the pose
steps.description: To exit, bring your hands back to your hips, lead with your chest, and slowly come up to a kneeling position. Sit back on your heels and relax for a few moments.

benefits: Opens the chest, shoulders, and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May aid digestion and promote relaxation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back, shoulder, or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Camel Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start on your hands and knees
steps.description: Begin in a tabletop position, with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Keep your spine neutral and gaze downward.

steps.name: Exhale and round your spine
steps.description: As you exhale, gently round your spine towards the ceiling, tucking your chin towards your chest, and drawing your belly button towards your spine. This creates the cat-like shape.

steps.name: Engage your abdominal muscles
steps.description: Engage your abdominal muscles to support the rounding of your back. Make sure your shoulders and knees stay in position.

steps.name: Relax your neck
steps.description: Keep your neck relaxed and in line with your spine. Avoid forcing your chin to your chest.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the cat pose for a few breaths, feeling the stretch along your spine and in your neck.

steps.name: Return to the starting position
steps.description: On an inhale, gently return to the neutral tabletop position. You can move into the cow pose for a balanced spinal stretch or rest in the neutral position.

benefits: Relieves tension in the lower back and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help with digestion and constipation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Cat Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Ensure your knees are set directly below your hips and your wrists, elbows, and shoulders are in line and perpendicular to the floor. Keep your head in a neutral position, eyes looking at the floor.

steps.name: Cow Pose - Inhale
steps.description: As you inhale, lower your belly towards the mat. Lift your chin and chest, and gaze up toward the ceiling. Broaden across your shoulder blades and draw your shoulders away from your ears.

steps.name: Transition to Cat Pose - Exhale
steps.description: As you exhale, draw your belly to your spine and round your back toward the ceiling. The pose should look like a cat stretching its back. Release your head toward the floor, but donâ€™t force your chin to your chest.

steps.name: Inhale, return to Cow Pose
steps.description: Inhale, coming back into Cow Pose, and then exhale as you return to Cat Pose. Move in a fluid motion, transitioning between these two poses with each inhale and exhale.

steps.name: Continue the flow
steps.description: Continue flowing back and forth from Cow Pose to Cat Pose, and ensure your movements are in time with your breath. Do this for 1-2 minutes, or as long as it feels comfortable.

steps.name: Return to a neutral tabletop position
steps.description: After completing the sequence, return to a neutral tabletop position. Take a couple of breaths here to settle your movement and balance your body.

benefits: Relieves tension in the lower back and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help with digestion and constipation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Cat Cow Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a Plank Pose
steps.description: Begin in a plank pose with your shoulders directly over your wrists, your body in a straight line from head to heels.

steps.name: Lower your knees, chest, and chin to the floor
steps.description: Exhale and lower your knees to the floor, then your chest, and finally your chin, keeping your hips up and elbows hugged to your sides.

steps.name: Slide forward to a Low Cobra
steps.description: Inhale and slide forward, lowering your hips while pushing through your hands to lift your chest into a low cobra pose. Your elbows should remain bent and hugged to your sides.

steps.name: Engage your lower back muscles
steps.description: Engage your lower back muscles to support the lift of your chest. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears.

steps.name: Hold the Low Cobra
steps.description: Hold the low cobra pose for a breath, keeping your gaze forward and slightly upward without straining your neck.

steps.name: Press back to a Child's Pose
steps.description: Exhale and gently press back into a child's pose, resting your buttocks on your heels and your forehead on the mat. Stretch your arms forward or rest them alongside your body.

benefits: Warms up the body and prepares it for further yoga practice
Opens the hips, groin, and hamstrings
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help with digestion and constipation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, wrists, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Eight-Limbed Salute
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Start by standing in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), with your feet either together or hip-width apart, depending on your balance and comfort. Distribute your weight evenly across both feet.

steps.name: Bend your knees
steps.description: Inhale and bend your knees, as if sitting back into an imaginary chair. Your thighs should be as parallel to the floor as possible. Keep your knees in line with your feet.

steps.name: Raise your arms
steps.description: Lift your arms overhead, keeping them either parallel to each other or palms touching. Stretch up through your fingertips, while relaxing your shoulders away from your ears.

steps.name: Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and maintain a neutral spine. Tuck your tailbone slightly under to avoid over-arching your lower back.

steps.name: Focus on your breath
steps.description: Stay in this pose for several breaths. Keep your breathing steady and focus on sitting back deeper with each exhale.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, exhale and straighten your legs, lowering your arms to your sides. Return to Mountain Pose and take a moment to feel the effects of the pose.

benefits: Strengthens the core, thighs, and glutes
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back, hip, knee, or ankle injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Chair Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start on your hands and knees
steps.description: Begin in a tabletop position on your hands and knees. Make sure your knees are set directly below your hips and your hands slightly forward of your shoulders.

steps.name: Lower your hips to your heels
steps.description: Exhale and slowly sit back on your heels, lowering your hips towards your feet. If comfortable, your buttocks should rest on your heels.

steps.name: Extend your arms forward
steps.description: Stretch your arms forward on the floor in front of you, palms facing down. Keep your arms active and extended to lengthen the spine.

steps.name: Rest your forehead on the floor
steps.description: Gently lower your forehead to the floor. You can place a cushion or folded blanket under your forehead for comfort if needed.

steps.name: Relax your entire body
steps.description: Allow your entire body to relax. Soften your back and let go of any tension in your shoulders, arms, and legs. Breathe deeply and remain in this restful pose for as long as needed.

steps.name: Exit the pose
steps.description: When you are ready to exit the pose, use your hands to gently walk your torso back up to a seated position on your heels. Take a moment to adjust and breathe before moving on.

benefits: Relieves tension in the lower back and spine
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, wrists, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Child's Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Lie on your stomach
steps.description: Begin by lying flat on your stomach with your legs extended behind you, tops of the feet pressing into the mat. Place your hands under your shoulders with your elbows close to your body.

steps.name: Press into your palms
steps.description: Press firmly into your palms and slowly start to lift your chest off the floor. Keep your elbows slightly bent and close to your sides.

steps.name: Lift your chest
steps.description: Inhale and lift your chest further off the floor, straightening your arms as much as is comfortable. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears.

steps.name: Engage your lower back muscles
steps.description: Engage your lower back muscles and slightly tuck your hips to avoid compressing the lower back. Your gaze should be forward or slightly upward, ensuring no strain in your neck.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths. Focus on opening your chest and lengthening your spine with each inhale.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, exhale and slowly lower your chest and forehead back to the mat. Rest for a moment before moving to your next pose.

benefits: Opens the chest, shoulders, and lungs
Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back, neck, or shoulder injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Cobra Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Lie flat on your back
steps.description: Begin by lying on your back on the floor or on a yoga mat. Ensure that your spine is straight and your legs are extended. Let your feet fall open naturally.

steps.name: Relax your arms
steps.description: Place your arms at your sides with your palms facing up. Allow your fingers to curl naturally, and make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears.

steps.name: Close your eyes
steps.description: Gently close your eyes and focus on relaxing every part of your body. Start from the top of your head and move down to your toes, consciously releasing any tension.

steps.name: Breathe deeply
steps.description: Breathe deeply and evenly, allowing your body to sink deeper into relaxation with each exhale. Let your breath be natural and unforced.

steps.name: Remain in the pose
steps.description: Stay in Corpse Pose for 5-10 minutes, or longer if you have the time. Use this pose to rest and rejuvenate your mind and body.

steps.name: Gently exit the pose
steps.description: To exit the pose, start by deepening your breath. Then, gently wiggle your fingers and toes, slowly awakening your body. Roll to one side and rest there for a moment before sitting up.

benefits: Promotes deep relaxation and stress reduction
Reduces fatigue and promotes restful sleep
May help with chronic pain and anxiety
Offers a time to connect with your inner self
precautions: Not recommended for people who are unable to lie flat on their backs due to injuries or medical conditions
If you have any concerns about practicing Corpse Pose, it is always best to consult with a doctor or yoga instructor

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Sit up tall, keeping your spine straight.

steps.name: Bend your knees and stack your knees
steps.description: Bend your knees and bring your feet towards your hips. Cross your right leg over your left leg, stacking your right knee on top of your left knee. Bring your right foot towards your left hip and your left foot towards your right hip.

steps.name: Raise your right arm
steps.description: Inhale and raise your right arm overhead, then bend your elbow to bring your right hand down the center of your back.

steps.name: Reach your left arm behind your back
steps.description: Exhale and extend your left arm to the side, then rotate it inward and reach it up your back from below. Try to clasp your right and left hands behind your back.

steps.name: Hold the pose with even breathing
steps.description: Sit up tall, keeping your head aligned with your spine. Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on keeping your breath even and steady.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, gently unclasp your hands and unfold your legs. Repeat the pose with the left leg on top and the left arm raised.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and chest
Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and shoulders
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May relieve back pain and tension
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Cow Face Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Align your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Keep your spine neutral and your gaze downward.

steps.name: Inhale and arch your back
steps.description: As you inhale, arch your back by lowering your belly towards the floor. Lift your head and tailbone up, creating a gentle curve in your lower back.

steps.name: Relax your shoulders
steps.description: Keep your shoulders relaxed, away from your ears. Ensure that your neck is in a comfortable position, aligned with the spine.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths, focusing on the gentle stretch in your abdomen and the relaxation of your back.

steps.name: Return to a neutral position
steps.description: After holding the pose, return to the neutral tabletop position. You can alternate with the Cat Pose for a balanced spinal stretch.

benefits: Relieves tension in the lower back and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help with digestion and constipation
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back or neck injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Cow Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a squat position
steps.description: Start in a squat position with your feet as close together as possible. Keep your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Place your knees on your upper arms
steps.description: Place your knees on the back of your upper arms, as close to your armpits as possible.

steps.name: Shift your weight forward
steps.description: Shift your weight forward, coming onto the balls of your feet. Gaze forward to maintain balance.

steps.name: Lift your feet off the ground
steps.description: Carefully lift one foot off the ground, then the other, balancing on your hands. Keep your elbows bent slightly.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to stabilize your pose. Keep your breathing steady and even.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for as long as you can maintain balance and control. Keep your gaze fixed and your breath smooth.

steps.name: Exit the pose
steps.description: To exit the pose, gently lower your feet back to the ground, returning to a squat position. Take a moment to rest before moving on.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and wrists
Opens the hips, chest, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Crane Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Dolphin Pose
steps.description: Start in Dolphin Pose, with your forearms on the ground, elbows directly under your shoulders. Clasp your hands together or keep your palms flat on the mat.

steps.name: Extend into a Plank position
steps.description: Walk your feet back until your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels, similar to a Plank Pose. Keep your forearms and palms pressed firmly against the ground.

steps.name: Engage your core and thighs
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and thighs to maintain a strong, stable position. Ensure your hips donâ€™t sag or lift too high.

steps.name: Keep your neck in line with your spine
steps.description: Keep your neck long and in line with your spine. Gaze slightly forward or down to maintain a neutral neck position.

steps.name: Hold the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on maintaining a strong and stable core. Breathe steadily and deeply.

steps.name: Exit the pose
steps.description: To exit the pose, lower your knees to the ground and rest in Childâ€™s Pose or transition to another posture.

benefits: Strengthens the core, shoulders, arms, and wrists
Opens the chest, hips, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Dolphin Plank Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start on your hands and knees
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Align your knees directly below your hips and your forearms on the floor with your shoulders directly above your wrists.

steps.name: Lower your forearms to the floor
steps.description: Lower your forearms to the floor with your elbows shoulder-width apart. Clasp your hands together or keep your palms flat on the mat.

steps.name: Lift your hips up and back
steps.description: Exhale and lift your hips up and back, forming an inverted 'V' shape with your body. Keep your head between your arms and gaze towards your feet.

steps.name: Press your forearms into the floor
steps.description: Press firmly into your forearms and hands, extending through your spine and tailbone. Keep your neck relaxed and spine long.

steps.name: Engage your core muscles
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to support your spine. Keep your legs straight or slightly bent if you have tight hamstrings.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on lengthening your spine and strengthening your shoulders.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, slowly lower your knees to the ground and rest in Childâ€™s Pose or transition to another posture.

benefits: Strengthens the core, shoulders, arms, and wrists
Opens the chest, hips, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Dolphin Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start on your hands and knees
steps.description: Begin in a tabletop position with your knees directly below your hips and your hands slightly forward of your shoulders. Spread your palms and turn your toes under.

steps.name: Exhale and lift your hips
steps.description: Exhale and lift your hips up and back, forming an inverted V-shape with your body. Straighten your legs as much as comfortable, keeping your heels reaching towards the floor.

steps.name: Press your hands firmly into the mat
steps.description: Press your hands firmly into the mat, extending through your arms. Keep your shoulders broad and rotate your upper arms outward to create space around your neck.

steps.name: Engage your thighs
steps.description: Engage your thighs, lifting them up as you continue to press down through your heels. Keep your head between your arms, gaze towards your feet or navel.

steps.name: Hold the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths, focusing on lengthening your spine and opening your shoulders. Breathe evenly and deeply.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, exhale and gently lower your knees to the floor, returning to a tabletop position or sitting on your heels in Child's Pose.

benefits: Opens the chest, lungs, and shoulders
Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe back, neck, or shoulder injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Downward-Facing Dog
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Start by standing in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. Distribute your weight evenly across both feet.

steps.name: Bend your knees slightly
steps.description: Bend your knees slightly and shift your weight onto your right foot.

steps.name: Cross your left thigh over your right thigh
steps.description: Lift your left foot off the floor and cross your left thigh over your right thigh. If possible, hook your left foot behind your right calf.

steps.name: Extend your arms straight in front of you
steps.description: Extend your arms straight in front of you, parallel to the floor. Cross your right arm over your left arm and bend your elbows.

steps.name: Wrap your arms and hands
steps.description: Wrap your arms so that your right elbow is tucked into the crook of your left elbow. Bring your palms to touch or as close as possible.

steps.name: Square your hips and shoulders
steps.description: Square your hips and shoulders to the front of the room. Sink deeper into the pose by bending your knees further.

steps.name: Hold the pose with focused breathing
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on your balance and maintaining steady breathing. Keep your gaze fixed on a point in front of you for balance.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: Gently unwind your arms and legs, returning to Mountain Pose. Pause for a moment, then repeat the pose on the other side, with your right thigh over left and left arm over right.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
Opens the hips, chest, and shoulders
May help improve digestion and reduce stress
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, back, or neck
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Eagle Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a seated position
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Sit up tall with a straight spine.

steps.name: Cross your legs at the shins
steps.description: Bend your knees and cross your legs at the shins, placing each foot beneath the opposite knee. Your knees should be wide, and your legs should form a comfortable triangle.

steps.name: Place your hands on your knees
steps.description: Rest your hands on your knees, palms down for grounding or palms up for energy. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your spine elongated.

steps.name: Align your head, neck, and spine
steps.description: Ensure your head, neck, and spine are aligned. Relax your feet and thighs, letting gravity naturally pull your knees towards the floor.

steps.name: Maintain the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Stay in this pose for a few minutes, focusing on your breath. Breathe deeply and evenly, allowing your mind and body to relax.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To exit the pose, gently uncross your legs and stretch them out in front of you. Shake out your legs and ankles if needed.

precautions: Not recommended for people with severe injuries or pain in the knees, hips, or ankles
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Easy Pose

steps.name: Begin in a seated position
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your right foot close to your body. Tuck your right arm under your right knee and place your right hand on the floor.

steps.name: Place your left hand on the floor
steps.description: Place your left hand on the floor at shoulder width apart from your right hand. Spread your fingers for better stability.

steps.name: Shift your weight forward
steps.description: Shift your weight forward and lift your body off the floor, balancing on your hands.

steps.name: Extend your left leg to the side
steps.description: Extend your left leg to the side while keeping your right leg hooked over your right arm. Try to keep both legs as straight as possible.

steps.name: Engage your core muscles
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to maintain balance and stability. Keep your gaze forward.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths, focusing on keeping your balance and maintaining the alignment of your arms and legs.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: Carefully release the pose and sit back down. Repeat the pose on the other side, switching the positions of your arms and legs.

benefits: Strengthens the core, shoulders, arms, and wrists
Opens the chest, hips, and spine
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, back, or knees
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Eight-Angle Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Begin in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), standing straight with your feet together and arms at your sides.

steps.name: Shift your weight onto your left foot
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your left foot, and bring your right knee towards your chest.

steps.name: Grasp your right big toe
steps.description: Reach down with your right hand and grasp your right big toe with the first two fingers and thumb.

steps.name: Extend your right leg
steps.description: Gradually extend your right leg forward. You can keep a slight bend in your knee if you need to. If you're unable to hold your toe, use a strap around your foot.

steps.name: Extend your left arm to the side
steps.description: Extend your left arm out to the side for balance. Keep your torso upright and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on balancing and maintaining a steady breathing pattern.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, gently bend your right knee and release your toe. Lower your foot to the floor and return to Mountain Pose. Repeat the pose on the left side.

benefits: Strengthens the core, hamstrings, and calves
May help improve circulation and digestion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, or hamstrings
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Extended Hand-To-Big-Toe Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Align your knees directly below your hips and your wrists under your shoulders.

steps.name: Walk your hands forward
steps.description: Walk your hands forward a few inches and curl your toes under.

steps.name: Lower your chest towards the floor
steps.description: Exhale and move your buttocks halfway back toward your heels. Lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your arms extended and elbows lifted off the mat.

steps.name: Rest your forehead on the mat
steps.description: Rest your forehead on the mat. Your neck should be relaxed, and your spine should be elongated.

steps.name: Press your hands into the floor
steps.description: Press your hands into the floor and stretch your arms while pulling your hips back toward your heels. Feel the stretch in your spine and shoulders.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for 30 seconds to a minute, focusing on deepening the stretch with each exhale.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, gently walk your hands back under your shoulders and return to a tabletop position.

benefits: Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, or wrists
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Extended Puppy Dog Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Warrior II
steps.description: Start in Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II) with your right foot forward. Your right knee should be bent at a 90-degree angle, and your left leg extended straight behind you.

steps.name: Extend your right arm
steps.description: Extend your right arm down, resting your right hand on the floor outside of your right foot. If you can't reach the floor, place your forearm on your right thigh or use a yoga block for support.

steps.name: Extend your left arm overhead
steps.description: Reach your left arm overhead, forming a straight line from your left heel through your left fingertips. Turn your palm to face down, and gaze up at your left hand.

steps.name: Open your chest and hips
steps.description: Rotate your chest and hips open towards the ceiling. Keep your right knee directly over your right ankle.

steps.name: Engage your core muscles
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to stabilize your torso. Keep your legs strong and grounded.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, deepening the stretch and maintaining balance. Focus on elongating through both sides of your body.

steps.name: Release and switch sides
steps.description: To release, press into your right foot and rise back up to Warrior II. Repeat the pose on the left side, with your left foot forward.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, chest, and shoulders
Strengthens the core, hamstrings, and quads
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Extended Side Angle Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a wide-legged stance
steps.description: Begin standing with your feet about 3-4 feet apart. Turn your right foot out 90 degrees and your left foot in slightly. Align your right heel with the arch of your left foot.

steps.name: Extend your arms
steps.description: Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor, palms facing down. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your chest open.

steps.name: Bend to the right
steps.description: Reach out to the right, hinging at your hip, and then lower your right hand down to your ankle, shin, or the floor outside your right foot. If you can't reach the floor, use a yoga block for support.

steps.name: Lift your left arm
steps.description: Lift your left arm straight up towards the ceiling, in line with your shoulders. Turn your head to gaze up at your left hand.

steps.name: Align your body
steps.description: Keep both legs straight with your knees unbent. Your torso and legs should form a flat plane, like the side of a triangle.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on expanding your chest and extending through the fingertips of your raised hand.

steps.name: Release and switch sides
steps.description: To release, inhale and press your feet into the floor to lift your torso back up. Pivot on your feet to repeat the pose on the opposite side, with your left foot turned out.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, chest, and shoulders
Strengthens the core, hamstrings, and quads
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the lower back, hips, knees, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Extended Triangle Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Dolphin Pose
steps.description: Start in Dolphin Pose with your forearms on the ground and your fingers interlaced. Ensure your elbows are shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Walk your feet closer to your elbows
steps.description: Walk your feet towards your elbows as close as you can, lifting your hips high. Your body should form an inverted 'V' shape.

steps.name: Lift one leg up
steps.description: Lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping it straight. Keep your foot flexed and toes pointing upward.

steps.name: Kick up with the other leg
steps.description: With a gentle hop, kick up your other leg so that both legs are up in the air. Keep your core engaged to help lift your body.

steps.name: Straighten your body
steps.description: Once up, straighten your body so it's in line with your arms. Your shoulders should stack directly over your elbows. Keep your head neutral and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Balance and breathe
steps.description: Find your balance and breathe steadily. Keep your legs active and your feet flexed. Engage your core for stability.

steps.name: Exit the pose
steps.description: To exit, gently lower one leg at a time back into Dolphin Pose. Rest in Child's Pose for a few breaths after coming down.

benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, wrists, core, and spine
Opens the chest, hips, and shoulders
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, back, or neck
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Feathered Peacock Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a seated position
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Sit up tall with your spine straight.

steps.name: Bend your knees
steps.description: Bend your knees and bring your feet towards your body. Place your right ankle on top of your left knee, aligning your right shin perpendicular to your left shin.

steps.name: Stack your shins
steps.description: Stack your right shin directly above your left shin. Your right ankle should be on your left knee and your right knee on your left ankle. Adjust so that both shins are parallel.

steps.name: Align your hips
steps.description: Ensure your hips are evenly grounded. If there's a gap between your top knee and the bottom ankle, support it with a cushion or folded blanket for comfort.

steps.name: Maintain an upright posture
steps.description: Sit up tall, lengthening your spine. Place your hands on your knees or the floor beside you for balance.

steps.name: Hold the pose with steady breathing
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on relaxing your hips and thighs. With each exhale, try to release tension in the hips.

steps.name: Release and switch sides
steps.description: To release, gently unwind your legs and extend them in front of you. Shake them out if needed, then repeat on the other side with your left shin on top.

benefits: Stretches the inner thighs, groin, and hips
May help improve posture and digestion
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the knees, hips, or lower back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Fire Log Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a squat position
steps.description: Start in a deep squat with your feet slightly wider than hip-width apart. Keep your spine straight and your hands together in a prayer position.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor
steps.description: Lean forward and place your hands flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart. Spread your fingers wide for stability.

steps.name: Lift your hips and position your legs
steps.description: Lift your hips higher, and snug your thighs as close as possible to your torso. Your knees should be bent.

steps.name: Extend your legs to the sides
steps.description: Press your hands into the floor and start to straighten your arms. Extend your legs to the sides as straight as possible, with your toes pointed.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to maintain balance. Keep your arms strong and shoulders away from your ears.

steps.name: Balance and hold the pose
steps.description: Balance on your hands and hold the pose for a few breaths. Keep your gaze forward and your breathing steady.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, gently lower your feet back to the ground, returning to a squat position. Take a moment to rest before moving on.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and wrists
Opens the chest, hips, and shoulders
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, shoulders, elbows, back, or neck
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Firefly Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in Easy Pose
steps.description: Start by sitting in Easy Pose (Sukhasana), with your legs crossed and your spine straight. Place your hands on your knees or in your lap.

steps.name: Lean back on your hands
steps.description: Place your hands behind you, fingers pointing towards your body, and lean back slightly onto your hands.

steps.name: Arch your back
steps.description: Inhale and gently arch your back, tilting your head back to open up your chest. Press into your hands and forearms to lift your chest higher.

steps.name: Lower your head towards the floor
steps.description: If comfortable, lower your head towards the floor, bringing the crown to touch the ground. If this causes any discomfort, keep your chin tucked towards your chest.

steps.name: Maintain the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, feeling the stretch in your chest and throat. Keep your legs relaxed and your breath steady.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To exit the pose, lift your head and torso back up with the support of your hands. Return to Easy Pose and take a few deep breaths before moving on.

benefits: Opens the chest, heart, and lungs
Improves flexibility in the spine, hips, and shoulders
May help improve digestion and reduce stress
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the neck, back, or shoulders
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Easy Fish Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in Plank Pose
steps.description: Begin in Plank Pose with your shoulders over your wrists and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.

steps.name: Lower your body
steps.description: As you exhale, lower your body towards the floor, keeping your upper arms parallel to your sides. Your elbows should bend and point directly back, hugging into your sides.

steps.name: Align your body
steps.description: Keep your body straight and parallel to the floor, only a few inches above the ground. Avoid letting your hips sag or lift up too high.

steps.name: Keep your gaze forward
steps.description: Maintain a neutral neck and spine by keeping your gaze slightly forward, rather than looking up or down.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to support your spine and maintain the alignment. Press the floor away with your hands.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for a breath or two, keeping your body strong and engaged.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, either lower down to your belly or press back up to Plank Pose, then transition to Downward-Facing Dog or your next pose.

benefits: Strengthens the core, chest, shoulders, and arms
Opens the hips, groin, and hamstrings
May help improve digestion and reduce stress
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the wrists, elbows, shoulders, back, or neck
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Four-Limbed Staff Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a squat position
steps.description: Begin by squatting with your feet as close together as possible. Keep your heels on the floor if you can, or support them on a folded mat or blanket.

steps.name: Separate your thighs
steps.description: Separate your thighs slightly wider than your torso. Exhale as you lean your torso forward, fitting it snugly between your thighs.

steps.name: Press your elbows against your knees
steps.description: Bring your palms together in a prayer position (Anjali Mudra) and press your elbows against your knees. This will help to open your hips and deepen the stretch.

steps.name: Keep your spine straight
steps.description: Maintain a straight spine, with your shoulders relaxed and chest open. Gaze forward and keep your breath steady.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for 30 seconds to a minute, focusing on the opening of your hips and maintaining a steady breath.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, exhale and straighten your legs, returning to a standing position. Shake out your legs and feet if needed.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Strengthens the core, thighs, and ankles
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help reduce stress and anxiety
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the hips, knees, or ankles
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Garland Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Begin in a kneeling position
steps.description: Start by kneeling on the floor. Your thighs should be perpendicular to the floor, and the tops of your feet should be flat against the mat.

steps.name: Extend your right leg to the side
steps.description: Extend your right leg out to the side, keeping it straight. Your right foot should be flat on the floor, toes pointing forward.

steps.name: Raise your arms to shoulder height
steps.description: Inhale and extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing down.

steps.name: Slide your right hand down your right leg
steps.description: Exhale and slide your right hand down your right leg, as far as comfortably possible. Keep your left arm extended towards the ceiling.

steps.name: Gaze upwards
steps.description: Turn your gaze towards your left hand, keeping your neck long and relaxed. Your chest should be open and facing forward.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, stretching through your left side. Keep your right leg active and engaged.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, inhale and come back up to a kneeling position. Extend your left leg out and repeat the pose on the left side.

benefits: Stretches the inner thighs, groin, and inner hamstrings
May help improve digestion and posture
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the knees, hips, or lower back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Gate Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start by lying on your stomach
steps.description: Begin by lying flat on your stomach with your legs extended behind you and your forehead resting on the mat. Place your arms alongside your body, palms facing up.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your heel towards your right hip. Keep your other leg straight and your hips grounded.

steps.name: Reach back with your right hand
steps.description: Reach back with your right hand and gently grasp the inside of your right foot or ankle.

steps.name: Press your foot towards your hip
steps.description: Gently press your right foot towards your hip, increasing the stretch in your thigh. Ensure that your hips remain squared and flat on the mat.

steps.name: Keep your head and chest relaxed
steps.description: Keep your head and chest relaxed on the mat. Focus on the stretch in your right thigh and hip.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, deepening the stretch with each exhale. Keep your breath steady and even.

steps.name: Release and switch sides
steps.description: To release, carefully let go of your foot and extend your leg back to the starting position. Repeat the pose on the left side.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Strengthens the core, legs, and ankles
Improves flexibility and range of motion
May help improve digestion and reduce stress
precautions: Not recommended for people with recent or severe injuries to the hips, knees, or ankles
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Half Frog Pose
Listen to your body and don't force the pose if you experience pain

englishName: Half Lord of the Fishes Pose

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you.

steps.name: Bend your knees
steps.description: Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor. Slide your left foot under your right leg to the outside of your right hip. Lay the outside of the left leg on the floor. Step the right foot over the left leg and stand it on the floor outside your left hip. The right knee will point directly up at the ceiling.

steps.name: Twist towards your right knee
steps.description: Exhale and twist toward the inside of your right thigh. Press your right hand against the floor just behind your right buttock, and set your left upper arm on the outside of your right thigh near the knee. Pull your front torso and inner right thigh snugly together.

steps.name: Press your right hand into the floor
steps.description: Press your right hand into the floor to help lengthen and straighten your spine. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for about 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply. With every inhalation lift a little more through the sternum, pushing the fingers against the floor to help. Twist a little more with every exhalation. Be sure to distribute the twist evenly throughout the entire length of the spine; donâ€™t concentrate it in the lower back.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, exhale and return to the starting position, uncrossing your legs. Repeat the pose on the opposite side.

benefits: Stretches the hips, hamstrings, and inner thighs
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries or herniated discs
Should be done with caution by people with high blood pressure or glaucoma
Pregnant women should consult with their doctor before practicing this pose

englishName: Lying Half Lord of the Fishes Pose

steps.name: Start by lying on your back
steps.description: Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms resting at your sides.

steps.name: Bend your knees
steps.description: Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.

steps.name: Cross your right leg over your left
steps.description: Lift your right leg and cross it over your left thigh, placing your right foot on the floor outside your left knee. Your right knee should be pointing upward.

steps.name: Twist to the left
steps.description: Gently roll both of your knees to the left side. Extend your right arm to the right side, keeping it in line with your shoulder.

steps.name: Turn your head to the right
steps.description: Turn your head to the right, gazing in the direction of your extended right arm. Keep both shoulders flat on the floor.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on relaxing into the twist with each exhale. Feel the stretch in your back and the gentle twist in your spine.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release the pose, bring your head and knees back to center. Uncross your legs and extend them on the floor. Repeat on the opposite side with your left leg crossed over your right.

benefits: Gently stretches the spine, hips, and legs
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries or herniated discs
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Avoid straining or overexerting yourself in the pose

steps.name: Start in Triangle Pose
steps.description: Begin in Triangle Pose with your right foot forward. Place your right hand on your right hip and extend your left arm straight up towards the ceiling.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and shift your weight into your right foot. Keep your left leg straight and strong, with your left foot firmly planted on the floor.

steps.name: Place your right hand on the floor
steps.description: Place your right hand on the floor, about 6 inches in front of your right foot. Keep your right hand directly below your right shoulder.

steps.name: Lift your left leg
steps.description: Lift your left leg up, keeping it straight and strong. Flex your left foot and point your toes towards the front of the room.

steps.name: Extend your left arm towards the ceiling
steps.description: Extend your left arm towards the ceiling, keeping it in line with your shoulder. Turn your gaze towards your left hand and keep your neck long.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on keeping your body strong and engaged. Keep your breath steady and even.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, exhale and return to Triangle Pose. Repeat the pose on the opposite side with your left foot forward.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, core, and back
Stretches the hips, hamstrings, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up before practicing this pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Press into your palms and lift your hips up toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Kick one leg up
steps.description: Shift your weight onto one leg and kick the other leg up toward the ceiling. Keep both legs straight and engaged.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to help you balance. Keep your gaze focused between your hands.

steps.name: Slowly bring the second leg up
steps.description: With control, bring the second leg up to join the first leg, coming into a fully inverted position.

steps.name: Balance and hold
steps.description: Balance in a handstand position, keeping your body straight and your core engaged. Hold for as long as you can, breathing steadily.

steps.name: Lower down with control
steps.description: To come down, lower one leg at a time with control back into a downward-facing dog position.

benefits: Increases flexibility in the shoulders, wrists, and core
Calms the mind and reduces stress
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with back injuries, carpal tunnel syndrome, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Practice against a wall until you have mastered the balance

steps.name: Lie on your back
steps.description: Start by lying on your back on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat.

steps.name: Bend your knees into your chest
steps.description: Bend both knees and draw them toward your chest.

steps.name: Grab the outsides of your feet or ankles
steps.description: Reach your hands to the outsides of your feet or ankles. If you can't reach, you can use a yoga strap or hold your calves.

steps.name: Open your knees wide
steps.description: Open your knees wide, bringing them toward your armpits or chest. Your feet should be flexed.

steps.name: Gently rock side to side
steps.description: Gently rock your body from side to side while holding the happy baby pose, allowing for a gentle stretch in the hips.

steps.name: Hold and breathe
steps.description: Hold the pose for a few breaths, relaxing and releasing any tension in the hips.

steps.name: Release and extend your legs
steps.description: Release your feet and extend your legs back to the floor, coming out of the pose.

benefits: Stretches the hips, inner thighs, and hamstrings
precautions: Not recommended for pregnant women in their third trimester
Should be done with caution by people with hip injuries
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing tall in Tadasana with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.

steps.name: Shift your weight to one foot
steps.description: Shift your weight onto one foot and engage the muscles of that leg for stability.

steps.name: Bend the opposite knee and lift the foot
steps.description: Bend the knee of the opposite leg and lift that foot off the ground. Hold the big toe of the lifted foot with your fingers.

steps.name: Straighten the lifted leg
steps.description: While holding the big toe, straighten the lifted leg in front of you. Keep it as straight as possible.

steps.name: Extend the lifted leg to the side
steps.description: If comfortable, slowly extend the lifted leg to the side while keeping it straight. Your torso and other leg remain upright.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Maintain your balance and hold the pose, keeping your gaze steady. Breathe evenly.

steps.name: Return to center
steps.description: Gently bring the extended leg back to the center, still holding the big toe.

steps.name: Release the leg and return to Tadasana
steps.description: Release the held toe, bend the lifted knee, and lower the foot to the ground. Return to Tadasana with both feet on the floor.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the opposite side, shifting your weight to the other foot and lifting the other leg.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, inner thighs, and groin
Strengthens the core and leg muscles
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up before practicing this pose

steps.name: Start in Virasana (Hero Pose)
steps.description: Begin by kneeling on the floor with your knees and feet together. Sit back on your heels and keep your spine straight.

steps.name: Lower your upper body to the mat
steps.description: Lower your upper body backward to the mat, using your hands for support. Keep your knees and feet together as you recline.

steps.name: Rest your arms alongside your body
steps.description: Rest your arms alongside your body with your palms facing up. Allow your shoulders to relax and your chest to open.

steps.name: Lower your torso and head to the ground
steps.description: Continue to lower your torso and head to the ground, lying down on your back. Keep your legs together and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Relax in the pose
steps.description: Relax in the Reclining Hero Pose, allowing your thighs and shins to rest on the mat. Keep your eyes closed and focus on your breath.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold the Reclining Hero Pose for as long as comfortable, taking deep breaths and allowing any tension in your hips and thighs to release.

steps.name: To release, use your hands to help sit up
steps.description: To release the pose, use your hands to support your upper body and slowly sit up, returning to the kneeling Virasana position.

steps.name: Rest and repeat as desired
steps.description: Rest for a moment in Virasana before repeating the Reclining Hero Pose if desired. Be mindful of your comfort and flexibility.

benefits: Stretches the thighs, hips, and knees
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with knee injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Avoid excessive pressure on the knees

steps.name: Begin in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your spine straight and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend one knee and lift the foot
steps.description: Bend one knee and lift the foot off the floor. Keep the other leg extended and engaged.

steps.name: Interlace your fingers under the lifted thigh
steps.description: Reach your hands under the thigh of the lifted leg and interlace your fingers, creating a secure grip.

steps.name: Straighten the lifted leg
steps.description: While holding the thigh, begin to straighten the lifted leg, extending it toward the ceiling. Keep your back straight and chest lifted.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Maintain the straightened leg in a lifted position, balancing on your sitting bones. Keep your spine long and your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Breathe and hold for several breaths
steps.description: Take slow and deep breaths while holding the pose, finding a comfortable stretch in the hamstring.

steps.name: Release the leg and return to Dandasana
steps.description: Release the interlaced fingers and gently lower the lifted leg back to the floor. Return to Dandasana with both legs extended.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps with the other leg, bending the opposite knee and lifting the other foot.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, hips, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up before practicing this pose

steps.name: Start in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Begin in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), standing with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.

steps.name: Step forward with one foot
steps.description: Step your right foot forward about a leg's length, keeping your left leg back and your left heel lifted off the ground.

steps.name: Bend your front knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee so it's directly above your right ankle. Your left leg should be straight and strong, with your heel pushing towards the back of the room.

steps.name: Raise your arms
steps.description: Inhale and raise your arms overhead, keeping them parallel to each other. Your palms can face each other or be joined together.

steps.name: Square your hips
steps.description: Square your hips towards the front of your mat. Keep your torso upright and your spine straight.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on a steady and even breathing pattern. Feel the stretch in your left hip and the strengthening of your right thigh.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, exhale and lower your arms. Step your right foot back to meet your left, returning to Mountain Pose. Repeat the pose with your left foot forward.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, hips, and core
Stretches the hips, hamstrings, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with knee injuries, high blood pressure, or vertigo
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up before practicing this pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing tall in Tadasana with your feet together and your arms at your sides.

steps.name: Step your feet apart
steps.description: Step your feet apart, approximately 3 to 4 feet apart, depending on your flexibility.

steps.name: Turn your feet parallel to each other
steps.description: Turn both of your feet so they are parallel to each other, pointing forward.

steps.name: Place your hands on your hips
steps.description: Rest your hands on your hips to support your lower back throughout the pose.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine, lifting your chest and keeping your back straight.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips
steps.description: Exhale and begin to hinge at your hips, leaning your upper body forward over your extended legs.

steps.name: Bring your hands to the floor or blocks
steps.description: Reach your hands toward the floor, bringing them to the floor if possible. If you can't reach the floor, use yoga blocks for support.

steps.name: Keep your spine straight
steps.description: Maintain a straight spine as you fold forward, keeping your chest open.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the intense side stretch pose for several breaths, feeling a stretch along the back of your legs and your hamstrings.

steps.name: To release, inhale and come up
steps.description: Inhale as you slowly come back up to a standing position, engaging your core and keeping your spine long.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps, this time hinging at your hips to the other side, if desired.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, inner thighs, and side of the body
Helps to relieve stress and anxiety
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up before practicing this pose

steps.name: Find a clear wall space
steps.description: Begin by finding a clear wall space in a quiet area where you can practice this pose.

steps.name: Sit with your hip close to the wall
steps.description: Sit with one hip close to the wall, your legs extended in front of you.

steps.name: Lie down and swing your legs up
steps.description: Lie down on your back and swing your legs up along the wall. Your buttocks should be as close to the wall as comfortable.

steps.name: Adjust your distance from the wall
steps.description: Adjust your distance from the wall so that your legs are straight up, and your body forms an L shape. Your arms can be placed by your sides with your palms facing up.

steps.name: Relax and breathe
steps.description: Relax in this position, allowing your body to be fully supported by the wall. Close your eyes and take slow, deep breaths.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the legs-up-the-wall pose for 5 to 15 minutes, focusing on your breath and allowing tension to release.

steps.name: To come out of the pose
steps.description: Bend your knees and roll onto one side. Use your hands to help you sit up slowly.

steps.name: Rest in a seated position
steps.description: Sit quietly for a moment, allowing your body to adjust before continuing with your practice or daily activities.

precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure, glaucoma, or retinal detachment
Pregnant women should consult with their doctor before practicing this pose

steps.name: Begin in prone position
steps.description: Start by lying face down on your mat in a prone position with your arms alongside your body and your forehead on the floor.

steps.name: Place your arms under your body
steps.description: Place your arms under your body with your palms facing down. Your hands should be positioned near your hips, with your elbows close to your torso.

steps.name: Engage your core and legs
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and squeeze your legs together, pressing your thighs firmly against each other.

steps.name: Inhale and lift your chest and legs
steps.description: Inhale as you lift your chest, head, arms, and legs off the floor. Keep your gaze down to avoid straining your neck.

steps.name: Lift as high as comfortable
steps.description: Continue to lift your chest and legs as high as is comfortable for you. The weight of your body should be supported by your lower abdomen and pelvis.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the locust pose for several breaths, keeping your breath steady and your back muscles engaged.

steps.name: Exhale and lower down
steps.description: Exhale as you gently lower your chest, head, arms, and legs back down to the mat. Rest with your forehead on the floor.

steps.name: Repeat as desired
steps.description: You can repeat the locust pose for additional rounds if you'd like to continue strengthening your back and core.

benefits: Strengthens the back, legs, and core
Helps to relieve stress and anxiety
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries or herniated discs
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing tall in Tadasana with your feet together and your arms at your sides.

steps.name: Shift your weight to one leg
steps.description: Shift your weight onto one leg and engage the muscles of that leg for stability.

steps.name: Bend the opposite knee and reach back with your hand
steps.description: Bend the knee of the opposite leg and reach back with your hand to grab the ankle or foot of that leg.

steps.name: Lift the opposite arm forward
steps.description: As you hold onto your ankle or foot, simultaneously lift the opposite arm forward, extending it straight in front of you.

steps.name: Kick the lifted leg back and up
steps.description: Begin to kick the lifted leg back and up, simultaneously arching your torso forward. Your raised leg should be parallel to the floor or higher.

steps.name: Maintain balance and hold the pose
steps.description: Balance on the standing leg and hold the lord of the dance pose. Keep your chest open, gaze focused, and engage your core.

steps.name: Release the pose with control
steps.description: To release, slowly lower your lifted leg and return to a standing position, releasing your hand from your ankle or foot.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the opposite side, shifting your weight to the other leg and lifting the other foot.

benefits: Stretches the hips, hamstrings, and inner thighs
Strengthens the legs, core, and arms
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you in Dandasana (Staff Pose). Keep your spine straight.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your heel toward your pubic bone. Your right foot should be flexed.

steps.name: Bend your left knee
steps.description: Bend your left knee and bring your heel toward your pubic bone. Your left foot should also be flexed.

steps.name: Place your right foot on your left thigh
steps.description: Gently lift your right foot and place it on top of your left thigh, with the sole of your right foot facing upward and your heel close to your abdomen.

steps.name: Place your left foot on your right thigh
steps.description: Similarly, lift your left foot and place it on top of your right thigh, with the sole of your left foot facing upward and your heel close to your abdomen.

steps.name: Rest your hands on your knees
steps.description: Rest your hands on your knees with your palms facing up. Keep your spine erect and your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the Lotus Pose for several breaths, maintaining a comfortable and steady position.

steps.name: To release, reverse the steps
steps.description: To release the pose, first uncross your legs and return to a seated position with your legs extended. Shake out your legs if needed.

benefits: Improves spinal flexibility and hip mobility
Stretches the inner thighs, hamstrings, and groin
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted, and your body forming an inverted V shape.

steps.name: Step your right foot forward
steps.description: Step your right foot forward between your hands, placing it close to your right thumb. Keep your left leg extended straight behind you.

steps.name: Lower your hips
steps.description: Lower your hips and pelvis toward the mat, sinking into a lunge position. Ensure your right knee is directly above your right ankle.

steps.name: Square your hips
steps.description: Square your hips to the front of the mat, ensuring that both hip points are facing forward. Engage your core for stability.

steps.name: Keep your chest lifted
steps.description: Keep your chest lifted and your spine long. Roll your shoulders back and down, opening your chest.

steps.name: Hold the low lunge
