steps.description: Hold the Low Lunge position for several breaths, allowing your hips to gently open and your hip flexors to stretch.

steps.name: To release, step back to Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: To release the pose, step your right foot back to Downward-Facing Dog, returning to the starting position.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps with your left foot forward to stretch the opposite side of your body.

benefits: Stretches the thighs, groins, and opens the chest
Strengthens the legs, core, and back
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with knee injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your spine straight and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and place your right foot flat on the floor, with your heel as close to your right sitting bone as possible.

steps.name: Cross your right foot over your left thigh
steps.description: Cross your right foot over your left thigh, positioning your right knee pointing toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Wrap your left arm around your right knee
steps.description: Reach your left arm around your right knee, bringing it as close to your right thigh as possible.

steps.name: Place your right hand on the floor behind your back
steps.description: Place your right hand on the floor behind your back, fingers pointing away from your body, and slightly away from your right hip.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine, sitting up tall and creating space between your vertebrae.

steps.name: Exhale and twist to the right
steps.description: Exhale and begin to twist your torso to the right, using the leverage of your left arm against your right knee. Keep your right hand on the floor for support.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold Marichyasana III for several breaths, deepening the twist with each exhalation while keeping your spine long.

steps.name: Release the pose and switch sides
steps.description: To release, unwind your torso, straighten your right leg, and return to Dandasana. Repeat the pose on the opposite side by bending your left knee.

benefits: Stretches the spine, hips, hamstrings, and inner thighs
Strengthens the core, legs, and back
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Begin in a seated position
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you, in Dandasana (Staff Pose). Keep your spine long and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your right foot to the floor, positioning it beside your right sitting bone.

steps.name: Lift your left leg off the floor
steps.description: Lift your left leg off the floor and extend it straight out in front of you. Keep your left foot flexed and toes pointing up.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor beside your hips
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor beside your hips, fingers pointing forward, for support and balance.

steps.name: Engage your core and begin to straighten your right leg
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and begin to straighten your right leg. As you straighten it, you'll start to lift your pelvis off the floor.

steps.name: Continue to lift your pelvis
steps.description: Continue to lift your pelvis and extend your right leg fully. Your left leg should remain lifted and extended in front of you.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold Hanumanasana for several breaths, keeping your spine long and your chest open. Flex both feet and point your toes toward the ceiling.

steps.name: To release the pose, bend your right knee
steps.description: To release the pose, bend your right knee and lower your pelvis back to the floor. Extend both legs in front of you and rest for a moment.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by bending your left knee and extending your right leg forward.

benefits: Stretches the entire lower body, including the thighs, hamstrings, and groin
Improves flexibility in the hips and spine
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose
Use props, such as blocks or straps, for support if needed

steps.name: Start by standing tall
steps.description: Begin by standing on your yoga mat with your feet hip-width apart. Stand tall with your arms at your sides, palms facing forward.

steps.name: Distribute your weight evenly
steps.description: Distribute your body weight evenly across both feet. Engage the muscles of your legs to create a stable base.

steps.name: Root down through your feet
steps.description: Press down through your feet, especially through the four corners of each foot. Feel a sense of grounding and connection to the earth.

steps.name: Lengthen your spine
steps.description: Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head toward the ceiling. Keep your shoulders relaxed and down.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles by gently drawing your navel toward your spine. This helps to stabilize your lower back.

steps.name: Roll your shoulder blades back
steps.description: Roll your shoulder blades back and down, opening your chest. Allow your arms to hang naturally by your sides.

steps.name: Stand with a strong, aligned posture
steps.description: Maintain a strong, aligned posture, with your chin parallel to the floor. Keep your gaze forward or close your eyes if comfortable.

steps.name: Breathe deeply and evenly
steps.description: Take slow, deep breaths, filling your lungs completely. Focus on the rhythm of your breath and the sense of presence in the pose.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold Mountain Pose for as long as desired, focusing on your breath and cultivating a sense of stillness and strength.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, core, and back
Cultivates a sense of grounding and stability
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back pain or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in a squatting position
steps.description: Begin by squatting down with your feet close together and your knees bent. Keep your heels on the ground or use a yoga block under your heels for support if needed.

steps.name: Bring your knees close together
steps.description: Draw your knees close together so they are touching or nearly touching. This will create a narrow base for the pose.

steps.name: Wrap your arms around your knees
steps.description: Reach your arms around the outside of your knees, bringing your hands in front of you. Cross your right arm over your left arm.

steps.name: Clasp your hands behind your back
steps.description: Clasp your hands behind your back, bringing your right hand to your left wrist or hand, and left hand to your right wrist or hand. This creates a bind behind your back.

steps.name: Lean forward and lift your heels
steps.description: Lean your torso forward slightly and begin to lift your heels off the ground. Keep your chest lifted and your spine long.

steps.name: Balance and hold the pose
steps.description: Balance in Pasasana, keeping your heels lifted and your arms bound behind your back. Engage your core for stability.

steps.name: Hold the pose for several breaths
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on your balance and breath. Keep your gaze steady.

steps.name: To release, lower your heels and unbind your hands
steps.description: Gently lower your heels back to the ground and release your hands. Come back to a squatting position.

steps.name: Repeat as desired
steps.description: You can repeat Pasasana as desired to further improve your balance and flexibility.

benefits: Improves spinal flexibility and hip mobility
Stretches the inner thighs, hamstrings, and groin
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

sanskritName: Sukha Eka Pada Raja Kapotasana I

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin in a tabletop position on your hands and knees, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.

steps.name: Slide your right knee forward
steps.description: Slide your right knee forward toward your right wrist, angling it slightly to the right. Your right heel should be close to your left hip.

steps.name: Extend your left leg straight back
steps.description: Extend your left leg straight back behind you, keeping your toes pointing and the top of your foot resting on the mat.

steps.name: Square your hips
steps.description: Square your hips as much as possible, ensuring that your right hip doesn't lift too much. Aim to have both hips facing forward.

steps.name: Walk your hands forward
steps.description: Walk your hands forward in front of you, lowering your chest toward the floor. Keep your arms extended and your chest open.

steps.name: Lower down and relax
steps.description: Lower your upper body and chest toward the mat, as far as your flexibility allows. You can rest your forehead on the mat or on a block.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the One-Legged King Pigeon Pose for several breaths, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Feel the stretch in your right hip and thigh.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, walk your hands back toward your body, lift your chest, and slide your right knee back to the tabletop position.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the pose on the other side by bringing your left knee forward and extending your right leg straight back.

benefits: Stretches the hips, thighs, groin, and hamstrings
Strengthens the legs, core, and back
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted, and your body forming an inverted V shape.

steps.name: Lift your right leg
steps.description: From Downward-Facing Dog, lift your right leg up and back behind you, keeping it straight and engaged.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and bring it forward
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring it forward toward your chest, aiming to bring it as close to your right wrist as possible.

steps.name: Lower your right hip to the mat
steps.description: As you bend your right knee and bring it forward, lower your right hip to the mat. Your right foot should be angled slightly outward.

steps.name: Extend your left leg back
steps.description: Extend your left leg straight back behind you, keeping it active and pressing through the heel.

steps.name: Square your hips
steps.description: Square your hips as much as possible, ensuring that your right hip doesn't lift too much. Aim to have both hips facing forward.

steps.name: Walk your hands forward and lower your chest
steps.description: Walk your hands forward in front of you, lowering your chest toward the mat. Keep your arms extended and your chest open.

steps.name: Lower down and relax
steps.description: Lower your upper body and chest toward the mat, as far as your flexibility allows. You can rest your forehead on the mat or on a block.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the One-Legged King Pigeon Pose II for several breaths, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Feel the stretch in your right hip and thigh.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, walk your hands back toward your body, tuck your left toes, and lift your hips back into Downward-Facing Dog. Repeat on the other side.

benefits: Opens the chest, shoulders, and hips
Stretches the hamstrings, thighs, and groin
Strengthens the legs, core, and back
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a kneeling position
steps.description: Begin by kneeling on the floor with your big toes touching and your knees slightly apart.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor
steps.description: Place your palms flat on the floor in front of you, with your fingers spread wide apart. Position your hands so that your fingers are pointing toward your body.

steps.name: Lean forward and bend your elbows
steps.description: Lean your upper body forward and bend your elbows, bringing them in toward your abdomen. Keep your elbows close together.

steps.name: Lift your knees off the floor
steps.description: Shift your body weight forward, engage your core, and lift your knees off the floor. Your lower legs should be parallel to the floor.

steps.name: Balance on your hands
steps.description: Balance on your hands and keep your elbows bent. Your body should form a straight line from your head to your heels.

steps.name: Engage your core and hold the pose
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to help you maintain balance. Hold the Peacock Pose for as long as you can, breathing steadily.

steps.name: To release, lower your knees to the floor
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your knees back to the floor with control, and sit back on your heels.

steps.name: Rest in Child's Pose
steps.description: Rest in Child's Pose for a moment to recover before continuing with your practice.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
Activates the muscles of the legs
Provides a deep stretch to the hamstrings
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, neck injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women or anyone with a history of injuries
If you cannot lift your upper body, you can support yourself on your forearms
If you are experiencing pain, stop the pose immediately

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin in a tabletop position on your hands and knees, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.

steps.name: Bring your right knee forward
steps.description: Slide your right knee forward toward your right wrist, angling it slightly to the right. Your right heel should be close to your left hip.

steps.name: Extend your left leg straight back
steps.description: Extend your left leg straight back behind you, keeping your toes pointed and the top of your foot resting on the mat.

steps.name: Square your hips
steps.description: Square your hips as much as possible, ensuring that your right hip doesn't lift too much. Aim to have both hips facing forward.

steps.name: Walk your hands forward
steps.description: Walk your hands forward in front of you, lowering your chest toward the floor. Keep your arms extended and your chest open.

steps.name: Lower down and relax
steps.description: Lower your upper body and chest toward the mat, as far as your flexibility allows. You can rest your forehead on the mat or on a block.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the Pigeon Pose for several breaths, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Feel the stretch in your right hip and thigh.

steps.name: To release, walk your hands back
steps.description: To release the pose, walk your hands back toward your body, tuck your left toes, and lift your hips back into a tabletop position.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the pose on the other side by bringing your left knee forward and extending your right leg straight back.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, inner thighs, and groin
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.

steps.name: Extend your legs straight back
steps.description: Extend your legs straight back behind you, one at a time, so that your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels. Keep your toes tucked under.

steps.name: Engage your core
steps.description: Engage your core muscles by drawing your navel toward your spine. This will help support your lower back and keep your body stable.

steps.name: Keep your body in a straight line
steps.description: Keep your body in a straight line, avoiding any sagging in your hips or arching in your lower back. Imagine a plank of wood from head to heels.

steps.name: Shoulders over wrists
steps.description: Ensure that your shoulders are directly over your wrists and that your arms are straight. Spread your fingers wide for stability.

steps.name: Engage your leg muscles
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles by pressing through your heels and lifting your kneecaps. Keep your thighs and glutes active.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the Plank Pose for as long as you can, maintaining proper alignment and breathing steadily.

steps.name: To release, lower your knees
steps.description: To release the pose, gently lower your knees to the mat, returning to a tabletop position.

steps.name: Rest and repeat as desired
steps.description: Rest for a moment and repeat the Plank Pose for additional rounds to build strength and endurance.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
Engages the muscles of the legs and back
Activates the muscles of the abdomen and pelvis
precautions: Not recommended for people with wrist injuries, shoulder injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid hyperextending your elbows
Maintain a neutral spine and avoid arching your back
If you have any concerns, consult with a healthcare professional before practicing this pose

steps.name: Start in a supine position
steps.description: Begin by lying on your back in a supine position with your legs extended straight and your arms alongside your body, palms facing down.

steps.name: Inhale and lift your legs overhead
steps.description: Inhale as you lift your legs overhead, keeping them straight. Use your abdominal muscles to lift your hips off the ground.

steps.name: Support your lower back with your hands
steps.description: Place your hands on your lower back for support, with your elbows bent and your fingers pointing upward. Your hands should support your lower back and hips.

steps.name: Continue to lift your legs
steps.description: Continue to lift your legs overhead until your toes touch the ground behind you. Your feet may or may not touch the floor, depending on your flexibility.

steps.name: Engage your core and elongate your spine
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to support your spine and create length in your neck. Keep your gaze directed toward your chest to avoid straining your neck.

steps.name: Hold the Plow Pose
steps.description: Hold the Plow Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and relaxing into the stretch.

steps.name: To release, lower your legs
steps.description: To release the pose, slowly lower your legs back down to the ground, one vertebra at a time, keeping your hands on your lower back for support.

steps.name: Rest in a supine position
steps.description: Rest in a supine position with your arms at your sides and take a few deep breaths to relax your body.

benefits: Improves spinal flexibility and hip mobility
Stretches the inner thighs, hamstrings, and groin
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted, and your body forming an inverted V shape.

steps.name: Step your right foot forward and shift your weight
steps.description: Step your right foot forward between your hands and shift your body weight forward onto your hands, bringing your shoulders over your wrists.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and lift your left foot
steps.description: Bend your right knee deeply and lift your left foot off the mat, bringing your left knee toward your chest.

steps.name: Engage your core and prepare for arm balance
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and prepare for the arm balance by shifting your weight onto your hands and bringing your left thigh as high up on your right triceps as possible.

steps.name: Lean forward and lift your left leg
steps.description: Lean your torso forward and begin to lift your left leg off the mat, extending it straight behind you while keeping it parallel to the ground.

steps.name: Balance and hold the pose
steps.description: Balance on your hands with your right knee bent and your left leg extended straight back. Keep your core engaged and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Hold the Eka Pada Koundinyasana I pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, maintaining balance and stability while focusing on your breath.

steps.name: To release, lower your left leg and step back to Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your left leg back down to the mat, step your right foot back to Downward-Facing Dog, and return to the starting position.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by stepping your left foot forward and lifting your right leg for Eka Pada Koundinyasana I.

benefits: Tones the arms, abs, and strengthens the wrist
Stretches the thighs, groins, and opens the chest
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted, and your body forming an inverted V shape.

steps.name: Step your right foot forward and shift your weight
steps.description: Step your right foot forward between your hands and shift your body weight forward onto your hands, bringing your shoulders over your wrists.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and lift your left foot
steps.description: Bend your right knee deeply and lift your left foot off the mat, bringing your left knee toward your chest.

steps.name: Engage your core and prepare for arm balance
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and prepare for the arm balance by shifting your weight onto your hands and bringing your left thigh as high up on your right triceps as possible.

steps.name: Lean forward and extend your left leg out to the side
steps.description: Lean your torso forward and begin to extend your left leg out to the side, parallel to the ground. Your left foot should be flexed.

steps.name: Balance and hold the pose
steps.description: Balance on your hands with your right knee bent and your left leg extended to the side. Keep your core engaged and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Hold the Eka Pada Koundinyasana II pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, maintaining balance and stability while focusing on your breath.

steps.name: To release, lower your left leg and step back to Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your left leg back down to the mat, step your right foot back to Downward-Facing Dog, and return to the starting position.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by stepping your left foot forward and lifting your right leg for Eka Pada Koundinyasana II.

benefits: Improves flexibility in the hips, hamstrings, and spine
Strengthens the arms, core, and legs
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, hip injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Keep your spine straight and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your heel toward your pubic bone, keeping your right foot flat on the floor.

steps.name: Place your right hand behind your back
steps.description: Reach your right hand behind your back, placing it on the floor a few inches behind your right hip, fingers pointing away from your body.

steps.name: Wrap your left arm around your right knee
steps.description: Bend your left elbow and wrap your left arm around your right knee, bringing your left hand toward your right thigh.

steps.name: Twist to the right
steps.description: Begin to twist your torso to the right, using the leverage of your left arm against your right knee. Keep your spine long.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold Marichyasana I for several breaths, deepening the twist with each exhalation while keeping your spine long and your chest open.

steps.name: To release, untwist and straighten your right leg
steps.description: To release the pose, untwist your torso, straighten your right leg, and return to Dandasana. Repeat the pose on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by bending your left knee and twisting to the left.

benefits: Stretches the back, shoulders, and hips
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back pain or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in a supine position
steps.description: Begin by lying on your back in a supine position with your legs extended straight and your arms resting alongside your body.

steps.name: Bend your knees and bring your feet together
steps.description: Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to fall open to the sides. Your feet should be close to your pelvis.

steps.name: Place your hands on your abdomen or by your sides
steps.description: Place your hands on your abdomen or rest them alongside your body with your palms facing up, whichever is more comfortable for you.

steps.name: Relax and open your hips
steps.description: Allow your hips to open and relax in this Reclining Bound Angle Pose. Let gravity gently bring your knees toward the ground.

steps.name: Breathe deeply and relax
steps.description: Close your eyes and take slow, deep breaths. Relax your inner thighs, groin, and hips as you breathe.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the Reclining Bound Angle Pose for as long as desired, focusing on deep and steady breathing and allowing your body to relax and open.

steps.name: To release, bring your knees together
steps.description: To release the pose, bring your knees together and extend your legs straight. Take a moment to rest in Savasana (Corpse Pose) if you like.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with hip injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women

steps.name: Start in a supine position
steps.description: Begin by lying on your back in a supine position with your legs extended straight and your arms resting alongside your body.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and draw it in toward your chest, keeping your left leg extended straight on the mat.

steps.name: Use a strap if needed
steps.description: If you cannot reach your right big toe with your right hand, use a yoga strap or a belt around the sole of your right foot and hold onto the strap with your right hand.

steps.name: Hold onto your right big toe or strap
steps.description: Hold onto your right big toe with your right hand or hold onto the strap securely if you are using one. Keep your left leg grounded and extended.

steps.name: Extend your right leg upward
steps.description: Extend your right leg upward, straightening it as much as your flexibility allows. Keep your left leg extended and active.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold the Reclining Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose for several breaths, keeping your leg extended and your back relaxed. Breathe deeply and evenly.

steps.name: To release, bend your right knee and lower your leg
steps.description: To release the pose, bend your right knee and lower your right leg back to the mat. Repeat on the other side by bending your left knee.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by bending your left knee and extending your left leg upward, holding onto your left big toe or using a strap if needed.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, ankles, and inner thighs
Improves flexibility in the hips and spine
Stimulates the digestive and respiratory systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Virasana (Hero Pose)
steps.description: Begin by kneeling on the floor with your knees and feet together. Sit back on your heels and keep your spine straight.

steps.name: Lower your upper body to the mat
steps.description: Lower your upper body backward to the mat, using your hands for support. Keep your knees and feet together as you recline.

steps.name: Rest your arms alongside your body
steps.description: Rest your arms alongside your body with your palms facing up. Allow your shoulders to relax and your chest to open.

steps.name: Lower your torso and head to the ground
steps.description: Continue to lower your torso and head to the ground, lying down on your back. Keep your legs together and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Relax in the pose
steps.description: Relax in the Reclining Hero Pose, allowing your thighs and shins to rest on the mat. Keep your eyes closed and focus on your breath.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold the Reclining Hero Pose for as long as comfortable, taking deep breaths and allowing any tension in your hips and thighs to release.

steps.name: To release, use your hands to help sit up
steps.description: To release the pose, use your hands to support your upper body and slowly sit up, returning to the kneeling Virasana position.

steps.name: Rest and repeat as desired
steps.description: Rest for a moment in Virasana before repeating the Reclining Hero Pose if desired. Be mindful of your comfort and flexibility.

benefits: Releases tension in the hips, knees, and ankles
Improves flexibility in the spine and legs
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your spine long and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee and bring your right foot in toward your inner left thigh. Keep your left leg extended straight.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine and sit up tall. Ensure that both sit bones are grounded on the floor.

steps.name: Exhale and twist to the right
steps.description: Exhale as you begin to twist your torso to the right, bringing your right hand to the inside of your right thigh.

steps.name: Wrap your left arm around your right knee
steps.description: Wrap your left arm around your right knee, bringing your left hand to the outside of your right thigh.

steps.name: Hold the twist and breathe
steps.description: Hold the Revolved Head-to-Knee Pose and continue to breathe deeply. Lengthen your spine with each inhale and deepen the twist with each exhale.

steps.name: To release, untwist and extend your right leg
steps.description: To release the pose, untwist your torso, extend your right leg, and return to Dandasana. Repeat on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by bending your left knee and twisting to the left.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Improves flexibility in the spine and hamstrings
Stimulates the digestive and reproductive systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Should not be practiced if you have a history of neck or spinal injuries
If you feel any pain in your lower back, knees, or hips, back out of the pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted, and your body forming an inverted V shape.

steps.name: Step your right foot forward between your hands
steps.description: Step your right foot forward between your hands into a lunge position, with your right knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your left leg extended straight back.

steps.name: Root your left hand and twist to the right
steps.description: Plant your left hand firmly on the mat, keeping it in line with your right foot. Begin to twist your torso to the right, reaching your right arm toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Open your chest and reach your right arm up
steps.description: Open your chest to the right and reach your right arm up toward the ceiling. Your right bicep should be alongside your right ear.

steps.name: Extend your left arm overhead
steps.description: Extend your left arm overhead, parallel to the floor, and reach it toward the front of your mat. Your left bicep should be alongside your left ear.

steps.name: Hold the pose and gaze up
steps.description: Hold the Revolved Side Angle Pose and gaze up at your right hand, keeping your neck in line with your spine. Engage your core for stability.

steps.name: To release, lower your right hand and return to Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Lower your right hand to the mat and return to Downward-Facing Dog. Repeat the pose on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by stepping your left foot forward and twisting to the left in Revolved Side Angle Pose.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and outer thighs
Improves flexibility in the spine and hamstrings
Stimulates the digestive and reproductive systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Should not be practiced if you have a history of neck or spinal injuries
If you feel any pain in your lower back, knees, or hips, back out of the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing at the front of your mat in Tadasana, with your feet together, arms at your sides, and your spine tall.

steps.name: Step your left foot back into a lunge
steps.description: Step your left foot back into a lunge position, keeping your right foot at the front of the mat. Ensure that your feet are about hip-width apart.

steps.name: Square your hips to the front of the mat
steps.description: Square your hips to the front of the mat by rotating your left hip forward. Your left heel may lift slightly off the mat.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine, reaching the crown of your head toward the front of the room. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, keeping your spine long, and begin to reach your right hand down toward your right shin or a block placed outside your right foot.

steps.name: Reach your left arm up toward the ceiling
steps.description: Simultaneously, reach your left arm up toward the ceiling, opening your chest and creating a twist. Your left bicep should be alongside your left ear.

steps.name: Hold the pose and gaze up
steps.description: Hold the Revolved Triangle Pose and gaze up at your left hand, keeping your neck in line with your spine. Engage your core for stability.

steps.name: To release, reverse the movements
steps.description: To release the pose, reverse the movements. Lower your left hand, square your hips, and step your left foot forward to return to Tadasana. Repeat on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by stepping your right foot back and twisting to the left in Revolved Triangle Pose.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and outer thighs
Improves flexibility in the spine and hamstrings
Stimulates the digestive and reproductive systems
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, knee injuries, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Should not be practiced if you have a history of neck or spinal injuries
If you feel any pain in your lower back, knees, or hips, back out of the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your spine straight and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Place your hands on the mat
steps.description: Place your hands on the mat, with your fingers pointing forward and your hands positioned slightly behind your hips.

steps.name: Bend your knees and lift your feet off the mat
steps.description: Bend your knees and lift your feet off the mat, bringing your heels close to your buttocks. Keep your feet flexed.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your hips
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and press down through your hands as you lift your hips off the mat. Your body weight should be supported by your hands.

steps.name: Straighten your legs and lift them off the mat
steps.description: Straighten your legs while keeping them parallel to the floor. Lift your legs off the mat, balancing on your hands and buttocks.

steps.name: Point your toes and hold the pose
steps.description: Point your toes and hold the Scale Pose, keeping your legs straight and parallel to the ground. Engage your core and maintain your balance.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold the Scale Pose for as long as comfortable, breathing steadily. Focus on maintaining balance and alignment.

steps.name: To release, lower your feet and hips to the mat
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your feet and hips back to the mat, returning to a seated position in Dandasana.

steps.name: Rest and repeat as desired
steps.description: Rest for a moment and repeat the Scale Pose for additional rounds to build strength and balance.

benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, wrists, and core
Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and inner thighs
Calms the mind and reduces stress
precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure, heart conditions, or neck or back injuries
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your spine tall, and your feet flexed, pressing the backs of your thighs into the mat.

steps.name: Inhale and reach your arms overhead
steps.description: Inhale as you reach your arms overhead, lengthening your spine and engaging your core. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, leading with your chest, and begin to reach forward toward your toes.

steps.name: Hold your shins, ankles, or feet
steps.description: Reach as far as your flexibility allows, and hold onto your shins, ankles, or feet, depending on your reach. Avoid forcing the stretch.

steps.name: Keep your back straight
steps.description: Keep your back straight and your gaze forward. Lengthen your spine with each inhale and deepen the stretch with each exhale.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Paschimottanasana for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the stretch.

steps.name: To release, slowly sit up
steps.description: To release the pose, slowly sit up, keeping your back straight. Return to Dandasana with your legs extended.

steps.name: Rest and repeat as desired
steps.description: Rest for a moment and repeat Paschimottanasana for additional rounds to improve flexibility and maintain a calm mind.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Relieves tension in the lower back and hips
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, sciatica, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a squat position
steps.description: Begin by squatting down with your feet hip-width apart. Keep your heels lifted slightly off the mat.

steps.name: Place your hands on the mat in front of you
steps.description: Place your hands on the mat in front of you, with your fingers spread wide and your palms firmly grounded. Your hands should be shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Lean forward and shift your weight onto your hands
steps.description: Lean your body forward and shift your weight onto your hands. Keep your knees on the backs of your upper arms, near your armpits.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your feet off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and begin to lift your feet off the ground. Start with one foot and then the other. Balance your body on your hands.

steps.name: Straighten your arms and point your toes
steps.description: Continue to straighten your arms as you lift your feet higher. Point your toes and extend your legs, keeping them parallel to the ground.

steps.name: Balance and hold the Crane Pose
steps.description: Balance in the Crane Pose, keeping your gaze forward and your core engaged. Breathe deeply and hold the pose for as long as you can.

steps.name: To release, gently lower your feet to the ground
steps.description: To release the pose, gently lower your feet back to the ground, returning to the squat position. Rest for a moment before repeating if desired.

steps.name: Practice for strength and balance
steps.description: Crane Pose requires practice to develop both strength and balance. Gradually work on extending the duration of the pose as you improve.

benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, wrists, and forearms
Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Calms the mind and reduces stress
Creates a sense of lightness and freedom
precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure, heart conditions, or neck or back injuries
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a plank position
steps.description: Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels. Keep your feet together.

steps.name: Shift your weight to your right hand and outer edge of your right foot
steps.description: Shift your weight to your right hand and the outer edge of your right foot, rotating your body to the side. Keep your left foot stacked on top of your right foot.

steps.name: Lift your left arm toward the ceiling
steps.description: Lift your left arm toward the ceiling, extending it straight up. Your left hand should be in line with your right hand.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your hips
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and lift your hips, creating a straight line from your head to your heels. Keep your gaze forward or upward.

steps.name: Hold the Side Plank Pose
steps.description: Hold the Side Plank Pose for as long as you can, maintaining balance and stability. Keep your body strong and aligned.

steps.name: To release, lower your left arm and return to a plank position
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your left arm back to the mat, return to a plank position, and then lower yourself to the mat. Repeat on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by shifting your weight to your left hand and the outer edge of your left foot, lifting your right arm toward the ceiling.

benefits: Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Relieves tension in the spine and shoulders
Creates a sense of stability and grounding
precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure, heart conditions, or neck or back injuries
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a seated position with your legs extended
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your spine tall and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Bend your right knee and place your right foot on the outside of your left thigh
steps.description: Bend your right knee and place your right foot on the outside of your left thigh, with your right heel close to your left hip.

steps.name: Cross your left foot over your right knee
steps.description: Cross your left foot over your right knee, placing it flat on the floor on the outside of your right thigh.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine and sit up tall, ensuring both sit bones are grounded on the floor.

steps.name: Exhale and twist to the right
steps.description: Exhale as you begin to twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow to the outside of your right thigh. Use your arm as leverage to deepen the twist.

steps.name: Place your right hand behind your back for support
steps.description: Place your right hand on the floor behind your back for support, with your fingers pointing away from your body.

steps.name: Turn your head to the right and gaze over your right shoulder
steps.description: Turn your head to the right and gaze over your right shoulder, deepening the twist and keeping your neck in line with your spine.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Ardha Matsyendrasana for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the twist.

steps.name: To release, untwist and return to the center
steps.description: To release the pose, untwist your torso, return to the center, and extend your legs. Repeat the pose on the other side.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by bending your left knee, placing your left foot on the outside of your right thigh, and twisting to the left.

benefits: Stretches the spine, particularly the lower back and the hamstrings
Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Relieves tension in the shoulders, neck, and back
precautions: Not recommended for people with back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Sphinx Pose
steps.description: Begin by lying face-down on your yoga mat. Place your elbows under your shoulders and your forearms on the floor, palms facing down. This is the Sphinx Pose.

steps.name: Position your hands
steps.description: Gently slide your hands back towards your ribcage, keeping your forearms and palms flat on the floor.

steps.name: Lift into Cobra
steps.description: Inhale and use the strength of your back, not just your arms, to lift your chest off the floor. Keep a slight bend in your elbows. Your pelvis and legs remain on the floor.

steps.name: Engage your lower back
steps.description: Engage your lower back muscles to support the lift. Be mindful not to overextend, and keep your shoulders away from your ears, elongating your neck.

steps.name: Use a prop for support
steps.description: For a supported variation, place a yoga block or a folded blanket under your pelvis. This will help support the lower back and reduce the intensity of the backbend.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on a steady inhale and exhale. Feel the gentle stretch in your spine and the engagement of your back muscles.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release, exhale and slowly lower your chest back to the floor. Slide your arms forward, returning to Sphinx Pose, and then relax completely on the mat.

benefits: Opens the chest, lungs, and heart
Relieves tension in the upper back and shoulders
Promotes a sense of calm and relaxation
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Sit on the floor with your legs extended
steps.description: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your feet flexed and toes pointing upward.

steps.name: Place your hands on the mat beside your hips
steps.description: Place your hands on the mat beside your hips, with your fingers pointing forward and your palms pressing down. Keep your fingers spread wide for stability.

steps.name: Engage your core and sit up tall
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and sit up tall, lengthening your spine and keeping your shoulders relaxed. Imagine your spine growing taller as you breathe.

steps.name: Flex your feet and press through your heels
steps.description: Flex your feet so that your toes are pointing back toward your body. Press through your heels to keep your legs active and engaged.

steps.name: Keep your back straight and gaze forward
steps.description: Maintain a straight back and gaze forward, keeping your neck in line with your spine. Your body should form a 90-degree angle with the floor.

steps.name: Hold the Staff Pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold the Staff Pose for as long as comfortable, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings and the strength in your core.

steps.name: To release, lower your hands and relax your legs
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your hands to the mat, relax your legs, and return to a seated position. You can shake out your legs if needed.

steps.name: Use a yoga block or cushion for support if necessary
steps.description: If you have difficulty sitting up tall, you can place a yoga block or cushion under your hips to provide support and make the pose more accessible.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing tall in Tadasana with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Keep your spine straight and your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Inhale and raise your arms overhead
steps.description: Inhale as you raise your arms overhead, reaching up toward the ceiling. Lengthen your spine and engage your core.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight, and bend forward from your hips. Lead with your chest.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor or reach for your ankles
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor beside your feet or reach for your ankles, depending on your flexibility. If you can't reach the floor, you can use yoga blocks for support.

steps.name: Keep your legs straight and engage your quadriceps
steps.description: Keep your legs straight with your knees locked. Engage your quadriceps to help stretch the hamstrings.

steps.name: Relax your neck and let your head hang
steps.description: Relax your neck and let your head hang down. Allow the weight of your head to deepen the stretch.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Uttanasana for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the forward bend.

steps.name: To release, inhale and rise back up
steps.description: To release the pose, inhale as you slowly rise back up to a standing position, reversing the movements. Keep your back straight as you come up.

steps.name: Return to Tadasana
steps.description: Return to Tadasana with your arms at your sides and take a moment to stand tall and grounded.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Relieves tension in the lower back and hips
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

englishName: Standing Tip Toe Half Intense Stretch Pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your spine tall and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Place your hands behind your hips with fingers pointing forward
steps.description: Place your hands on the mat behind your hips, with your fingers pointing forward and your palms pressing into the mat. Keep your hands shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor
steps.description: Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart, with your heels close to your sitting bones.

steps.name: Inhale and lift your hips toward the ceiling
steps.description: Inhale as you press through your hands and lift your hips toward the ceiling. Keep your chest open and shoulders rolled back.

steps.name: Exhale and press into your hands to lift your torso
steps.description: Exhale as you press into your hands to lift your torso off the mat, coming into a reverse tabletop position. Your body should form a straight line from head to knees.

steps.name: Engage your core and straighten your legs
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and begin to straighten your legs one at a time, extending them forward. Keep your toes pointing up and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold Ardha Purvottanasana for several breaths, maintaining a strong and straight alignment. Keep your neck in line with your spine.

steps.name: To release, bend your knees and lower your hips and torso to the mat
steps.description: To release the pose, bend your knees and lower your hips and torso back to the mat. Extend your legs in Dandasana to rest and reset.

steps.name: Repeat as desired
steps.description: You can repeat Ardha Purvottanasana for additional rounds to build strength and flexibility in your arms, shoulders, and core.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and inner thighs
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Relieves tension in the lower back and hips
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Plank Pose
steps.description: Begin in a Plank Pose, which is a push-up position with your palms flat on the floor, shoulders over your wrists, and your body in a straight line from head to heels.

steps.name: Lower into Chaturanga Dandasana
steps.description: Exhale and lower your body down, keeping your elbows close to your ribs, until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. This is Chaturanga Dandasana.

steps.name: Inhale and roll over your toes
steps.description: Inhale as you roll over your toes, lifting your chest and thighs off the mat. Your toes should be pointing downward.

steps.name: Lift one leg off the mat
steps.description: Lift one leg off the mat, keeping it extended and engaged. Your thigh should be off the mat, and your toes should be pointing back.

steps.name: Extend your leg higher
steps.description: Continue to extend and lift your lifted leg higher, aiming to bring it close to hip height. Keep your hips square and engage your glutes.

steps.name: Open your chest and look forward
steps.description: Open your chest by drawing your shoulder blades back and down. Look forward or slightly upward to maintain a neutral neck position.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Eka Pada Urdhva Mukha Svanasana for a few breaths, engaging your core and leg muscles. Maintain the lift of your chest and the extension of your lifted leg.

steps.name: Lower the leg and transition to the next pose
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your lifted leg back to the mat and transition to your next yoga pose, such as Downward-Facing Dog or another asana.

steps.name: Repeat on the other leg
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side, lifting the opposite leg to balance the pose and maintain symmetry in your practice.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Relieves tension in the lower back and hips
Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in Dandasana. Keep your spine tall, and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Open your legs wide to the sides
steps.description: Inhale and open your legs wide apart to the sides, forming a V shape with your body. Keep your toes pointing up toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Place your hands behind your hips
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor behind your hips, fingers pointing toward your body, and palms flat on the ground for support.

steps.name: Inhale and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine and lift your chest. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your chest open.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, leading with your chest, and begin to reach forward between your legs.

steps.name: Hold onto your shins, ankles, or feet
steps.description: Hold onto your shins, ankles, or feet, depending on your flexibility. Avoid forcing the stretch and keep your back straight.

steps.name: Keep your legs engaged and toes flexed
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles and flex your toes back toward your body to maintain an active stretch. Your knees can be slightly bent if needed.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Upavistha Konasana for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the stretch.

steps.name: To release, inhale and sit up
steps.description: To release the pose, inhale as you sit up and return to a seated position with your legs extended. Take a moment to rest before repeating if desired.

steps.name: Use props for support if needed
steps.description: If you have difficulty reaching your feet or if your back rounds, you can use yoga props like blocks or a cushion to support your hands or sit on.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and inner thighs
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Relieves tension in the lower back and hips
Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Lie on your back with your arms alongside your body
steps.description: Start by lying on your back with your arms resting alongside your body and your palms facing down. Keep your legs together and feet flexed.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and use your abdominal strength to lift your legs off the ground, bringing them over your head.

steps.name: Place your hands on your lower back for support
steps.description: Place your hands on your lower back, just above your buttocks, with your fingers pointing upward. Your elbows should be shoulder-width apart and your forearms should be on the ground.

steps.name: Lift your hips and legs upward
steps.description: Press your hands into your lower back and lift your hips and legs upward, bringing your body into an inverted V shape. Keep your legs straight and together.

steps.name: Support your back with your hands
steps.description: Continue to support your back with your hands, allowing your elbows to come closer together as you lift your legs higher.

steps.name: Extend your legs vertically toward the ceiling
steps.description: Extend your legs vertically toward the ceiling, creating a straight line from your shoulders to your feet. Keep your neck and head in a neutral position.

steps.name: Engage your leg muscles and breathe deeply
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles to keep your legs upright, and breathe deeply in this inverted position. Ensure your weight is supported by your shoulders and arms, not your neck.

steps.name: Hold the pose for several breaths
steps.description: Hold Supported Shoulderstand for several breaths, relaxing into the pose while maintaining stability and balance.

steps.name: To release, slowly lower your legs back to the ground
steps.description: To release the pose, slowly lower your legs back to the ground, one at a time, with control. Keep your hands on your lower back as you lower your legs.

steps.name: Rest in Savasana (Corpse Pose)
steps.description: After releasing the pose, rest in Savasana for a few breaths, lying on your back with your arms and legs extended, allowing your body to fully relax.

benefits: Improves circulation and blood flow to the brain
Strengthens the upper back and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure, glaucoma, or severe neck or back injuries
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing in Tadasana, with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. Ground yourself firmly through both feet.

steps.name: Shift your weight to your left foot
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your left foot, keeping your left leg strong and stable.

steps.name: Lift your right foot off the ground
steps.description: Bend your right knee and lift your right foot off the ground. Use your right hand to assist if needed, placing your right foot on your inner left thigh.

steps.name: Place your right foot on your inner left thigh or calf
steps.description: Position your right foot either on your inner left thigh, pressing gently to engage the hip, or on your inner left calf, avoiding direct pressure on the knee.

steps.name: Find your balance and engage your core
steps.description: Find your balance in Tree Pose, lengthening your spine and engaging your core muscles for stability. Keep your gaze fixed on a point for balance.

steps.name: Bring your hands to prayer position
steps.description: Bring your palms together at your heart center in a prayer position, also known as Anjali Mudra.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe
steps.description: Hold Tree Pose for several breaths, focusing on your breath and maintaining your balance. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: To release, lower your right foot and return to Tadasana
steps.description: Lower your right foot to the ground, returning to Tadasana with your feet hip-width apart. Take a moment to stand tall and centered.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by shifting your weight to your right foot and placing your left foot in Tree Pose.

benefits: Strengthens the ankles, legs, and core
Opens the hips, groin, and inner thighs
Improves spinal flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe balance issues or injuries to the ankles, knees, or hips
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start by lying on your back
steps.description: Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Place your feet hip-width apart, and your arms alongside your body with your palms facing down.

steps.name: Bend your elbows and place your hands by your ears
steps.description: Bend your elbows and place your hands on the ground by your ears, with your fingers pointing toward your shoulders. Your hands should be positioned shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Press through your hands and feet
steps.description: Press through your hands and feet as you lift your hips off the ground. Keep your elbows parallel to each other and your shoulders stacked over your wrists.

steps.name: Straighten your arms and lift your head off the mat
steps.description: Straighten your arms, lifting your head off the mat. Your neck should be relaxed, and your gaze can be directed toward your feet or the space between your hands.

steps.name: Continue to lift your chest and upper back
steps.description: Continue to lift your chest and upper back off the mat, arching your spine and coming into a deep backbend. Keep your thighs parallel to each other.

steps.name: Engage your legs and press through your toes
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles and press through your toes to lift your thighs off the mat. Keep your knees hip-width apart and your feet parallel.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Upward Bow (Wheel) Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and maintaining the arch in your spine.

steps.name: To release, lower your body back down
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your body back down to the mat one vertebra at a time, starting from your upper back and ending with your hips.

steps.name: Rest in Savasana (Corpse Pose)
steps.description: After releasing the pose, rest in Savasana for a few breaths, allowing your spine to return to a neutral position and your body to relax.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, spine, and shoulders
Opens the chest, lungs, and heart
Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

englishName: Elevated Both Legs Inverted Staff Pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in Dandasana. Keep your spine tall, and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Place your hands beside your hips with fingers pointing forward
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor beside your hips, with your fingers pointing forward and your palms flat on the ground. Your hands should be positioned shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Engage your core and press through your hands
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and press through your hands to lift your entire body off the ground. Keep your legs together and extended straight.

steps.name: Balance on your hands and lift both legs
steps.description: Balance on your hands, lifting both legs off the ground simultaneously. Your body should be parallel to the floor, supported by your hands.

steps.name: Keep your legs straight and toes pointed
steps.description: Maintain straight legs and pointed toes as you hold the Elevated Both Legs Inverted Staff Pose. Engage your leg muscles to keep your legs lifted.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Keep your gaze forward and your shoulders stable.

steps.name: To release, lower your legs and sit back down
steps.description: To release the pose, lower both legs back to the ground with control, and sit back down in Dandasana, extending your legs in front of you.

steps.name: Rest and reset if desired
steps.description: Take a moment to rest and reset before attempting the pose again or moving on to your next yoga practice.

benefits: Calms the mind and promotes relaxation
Strengthens the core and back muscles
Promotes a sense of peace and well-being
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe high blood pressure, glaucoma, or severe neck or back injuries
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in Dandasana. Keep your feet flexed, spine tall, and place your hands behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.

steps.name: Bend your knees and place your feet on the floor
steps.description: Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart, with your heels close to your sitting bones.

steps.name: Place your hands behind your hips with fingers pointing forward
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor behind your hips, with your fingers pointing forward and palms flat on the ground. Keep your hands shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Inhale and lift your hips off the ground
steps.description: Inhale as you press through your hands and feet, lifting your hips off the ground. Your body should form a straight line from your head to your knees.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your chest
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and lift your chest, arching your spine and creating a strong, upward-facing curve with your body.

steps.name: Keep your head in a neutral position
steps.description: Maintain a neutral position with your head, avoiding excessive tilting back or forward. Gaze softly at the horizon.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Purvottanasana for several breaths, breathing deeply and maintaining stability and strength in your arms, shoulders, and core.

steps.name: To release, lower your hips back to the ground
steps.description: Exhale and lower your hips back to the ground with control, returning to a seated position with your legs extended.

steps.name: Rest and reset if desired
steps.description: Take a moment to rest and reset before moving on to your next yoga practice or pose.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, spine, and shoulders
Opens the chest, lungs, and heart
Improves flexibility and range of motion
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, herniated discs, or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing tall in Tadasana, with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Ground yourself firmly through both feet.

steps.name: Engage your core and lengthen your spine
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and lengthen your spine, imagining your head reaching toward the ceiling. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Inhale as you raise your arms overhead
steps.description: Inhale deeply as you slowly raise your arms upward and overhead, with your palms facing each other and fingers pointing toward the sky.

steps.name: Keep your arms and legs straight
steps.description: Maintain straight arms and legs throughout the pose. Keep your arms alongside your ears as you reach up.

steps.name: Gently arch your back and lift your chest
steps.description: Gently arch your back and lift your chest, creating a slight backbend. Lift your gaze slightly upward, keeping your neck in line with your spine.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Upward Salute Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and feeling the stretch through your entire body.

steps.name: Exhale as you lower your arms and return to Tadasana
steps.description: Exhale as you slowly lower your arms back to your sides, returning to Tadasana. Take a moment to stand tall and grounded.

steps.name: Repeat as desired or as part of a sequence
steps.description: You can repeat Upward Salute Pose as desired, incorporating it into your yoga practice or using it as a transition between poses.

benefits: Calms the mind and promotes relaxation
Strengthens the arms, shoulders, and spine
Promotes a sense of peace and well-being
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe high blood pressure, glaucoma, or injuries to the arms, shoulders, or neck
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in prone position
steps.description: Begin by lying face down on the yoga mat in a prone position. Extend your legs straight behind you, with the tops of your feet on the floor.

steps.name: Place your hands beside your ribs
steps.description: Place your hands flat on the mat beside your ribs, with your fingers pointing forward. Your hands should be positioned close to your chest, shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Engage your core and press into your hands and feet
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and press firmly into your hands and the tops of your feet to lift your torso off the mat. Keep your thighs and knees off the ground.

steps.name: Straighten your arms and lift your chest
steps.description: Straighten your arms completely, lifting your chest and upper body off the mat. Keep your shoulders down and away from your ears.

steps.name: Arch your back and look forward
steps.description: Arch your back, allowing your head and gaze to lift upward and forward. Keep your neck in a neutral position, and avoid straining your neck by looking too far up.

steps.name: Keep your legs and pelvis off the ground
steps.description: Ensure that your legs and pelvis remain lifted off the ground. Your weight should be supported by your hands and the tops of your feet.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Upward Facing Dog Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and feeling the stretch through your chest and abdomen.

steps.name: To release, exhale and lower your torso to the mat
steps.description: Exhale as you lower your torso back down to the mat, returning to a prone position. Rest for a moment before transitioning to your next pose.

steps.name: Repeat or transition to the next pose
steps.description: You can repeat Upward Facing Dog Pose as part of your yoga sequence or transition into other poses as needed.

benefits: Strengthens the shoulders, arms, and core
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine
Calms the mind and promotes relaxation
Promotes a sense of peace and well-being
precautions: Not recommended for people with high blood pressure or glaucoma
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Begin in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), standing straight with your feet together and arms at your sides.

steps.name: Step back with one foot
steps.description: Step your left foot back about 3 to 4 feet, depending on your comfort level. Turn your left foot about 45 to 60 degrees to the left.

steps.name: Bend your front knee
steps.description: Bend your right knee, making sure your knee is directly above your ankle. Your right thigh should be parallel to the floor.

steps.name: Square your hips and shoulders
steps.description: Square your hips and shoulders to face the front edge of your mat. This might require adjusting the position of your back foot and hip.

steps.name: Raise your arms
steps.description: Inhale and raise your arms overhead, keeping them parallel to each other. Your palms can face each other, or you can join them together.

steps.name: Look up
steps.description: Gently tilt your head back and look up, keeping your neck relaxed. If this is uncomfortable, you can keep your gaze straight ahead.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths, focusing on a steady and even breathing pattern. Engage your core, and maintain a strong stance.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release, exhale and lower your arms. Step your left foot forward to meet your right, returning to Mountain Pose. Repeat the pose with the left foot forward.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, hips, and core
Promotes a sense of strength, courage, and focus
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe knee injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing in Tadasana at the top of your mat. Your feet should be hip-width apart, and your arms should be at your sides, palms facing forward.

steps.name: Step your left foot back
steps.description: Take a step back with your left foot, about 3 to 4 feet behind your right foot. Turn your left foot slightly outward, approximately 45 degrees.

steps.name: Align your heels and open your arms
steps.description: Align your right heel with the arch of your left foot. Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing down.

steps.name: Bend your right knee
