steps.description: Bend your right knee to create a 90-degree angle, making sure your knee is directly over your right ankle. Keep your thigh parallel to the floor.

steps.name: Keep your torso upright and gaze over your right hand
steps.description: Keep your torso upright and lengthen your spine. Gaze over your right hand, focusing your gaze beyond your fingertips.

steps.name: Engage your core and relax your shoulders
steps.description: Engage your core muscles to support your posture. Relax your shoulders and keep them away from your ears.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Warrior II Pose for several breaths, maintaining the strength and stability of your stance. Continue to breathe deeply.

steps.name: To release, straighten your right leg and return to Tadasana
steps.description: To release the pose, straighten your right leg, bring your arms down, and step your left foot forward to return to Tadasana at the top of your mat.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat Warrior II Pose on the other side by stepping your right foot back and bending your left knee. Maintain the pose for the same duration as on the first side.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, hips, and core
Promotes a sense of grounding, stability, and self-acceptance
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe knee injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Begin in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), standing with your feet together and your arms at your sides.

steps.name: Shift your weight onto one leg
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your right leg, keeping the knee slightly bent.

steps.name: Lean forward
steps.description: Start to lean forward, lifting your left leg up behind you. Keep your back straight and your body in one straight line from your head to your left heel.

steps.name: Extend your arms
steps.description: Extend your arms straight forward, parallel to the floor. For beginners, you can keep your hands on your hips or extend them out to the sides for more balance.

steps.name: Align your body
steps.description: Align your hips so that they are parallel to the floor. Point your toes of the lifted leg towards the floor and keep your gaze fixed on a point for balance.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several breaths. Keep your core engaged and your standing leg strong. Breathe deeply and maintain focus.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To come out of the pose, slowly lower your lifted leg back to the floor and return to Mountain Pose. Repeat on the other side with your left leg grounded and right leg lifted.

benefits: Strengthens the legs, hips, and core
Promotes a sense of courage, focus, and mental clarity
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe knee injuries, high blood pressure, or glaucoma
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Dandasana (Staff Pose)
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you in Dandasana. Keep your spine tall and your feet flexed.

steps.name: Open your legs wide apart
steps.description: Inhale and open your legs wide apart to the sides, forming a V shape with your body. Keep your toes pointing up toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Flex your feet and engage your quadriceps
steps.description: Flex your feet and engage your quadriceps to keep your legs active. Press your thighs into the floor.

steps.name: Inhale to lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine, lifting your chest and keeping your shoulders relaxed. Your fingertips can be on the floor beside your hips for support.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips to fold forward
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, leading with your chest, and begin to fold forward between your legs. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.

steps.name: Hold onto your shins, ankles, or feet
steps.description: Hold onto your shins, ankles, or feet, depending on your flexibility. Avoid forcing the stretch, and keep your back straight.

steps.name: Keep your legs active and toes flexed
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles and flex your toes back toward your body to maintain an active stretch. Your knees can be slightly bent if needed.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Wide-Angle Seated Forward Bend for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your body to relax into the stretch.

steps.name: To release, inhale and sit up
steps.description: To release the pose, inhale as you sit up, bringing your torso back to an upright position with your legs extended in front of you.

steps.name: Rest in Dandasana
steps.description: After releasing the pose, rest in Dandasana for a moment, keeping your legs extended, before continuing with your practice.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and groin
Opens the hips, pelvis, and lower back
Calms the mind and promotes relaxation
Promotes a sense of groundedness and stability
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries or high blood pressure
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing at the top of your mat in Tadasana, with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Take a moment to ground yourself and find your balance.

steps.name: Step your feet wide apart
steps.description: Inhale and step your feet wide apart, approximately 3 to 4 feet, or as comfortable for you. Ensure your feet are parallel to each other.

steps.name: Place your hands on your hips
steps.description: Place your hands on your hips, with your fingers pointing down toward the floor. Keep your spine long and engage your core.

steps.name: Inhale to lengthen your spine
steps.description: Inhale as you lengthen your spine and lift your chest, creating space in your upper body. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

steps.name: Exhale and hinge at your hips to fold forward
steps.description: Exhale as you hinge at your hips, leading with your chest, and begin to fold forward. Keep your back straight as you descend.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor beneath your shoulders
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor beneath your shoulders, with your fingertips in line with your toes. If flexibility is limited, use yoga blocks for support.

steps.name: Engage your leg muscles and keep your feet active
steps.description: Engage your leg muscles to maintain active legs. Press through your feet and keep them grounded as you fold deeper.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Wide-Legged Forward Bend for several breaths, allowing your body to relax into the stretch. Keep your neck relaxed and gaze forward.

steps.name: To release, inhale and lift your torso
steps.description: Inhale as you slowly lift your torso, keeping your back straight and your hands on your hips. Return to a standing position.

steps.name: Step your feet together and rest in Tadasana
steps.description: Step your feet together and rest in Tadasana for a moment, allowing your body to reset and re-center.

benefits: Stretches the hamstrings, calves, groin, and inner thighs
Opens the hips, pelvis, and lower back
Improves flexibility and range of motion
Strengthens the legs, core, and arms
Promotes a sense of inner peace and calm
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, high blood pressure, or glaucoma
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Begin in Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana), with your hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread wide, and your hips lifted toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Shift into Side Plank Pose (Vasisthasana)
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your right hand and roll onto the outer edge of your right foot, coming into Side Plank Pose. Stack your left foot on top of your right and extend your left arm toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Bend your left knee and lift your hips
steps.description: Bend your left knee and lift your hips higher, allowing your left foot to come over and behind your right leg. Your chest should open up toward the ceiling.

steps.name: Extend your left arm overhead
steps.description: Continue to lift your hips and extend your left arm overhead, reaching as far as you can while keeping your balance. Look toward your left hand.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Wild Thing Pose for several breaths, feeling the stretch in your chest and hips. Keep your core engaged and your breath steady.

steps.name: To release, return to Side Plank and then to Downward-Facing Dog
steps.description: Exhale as you carefully lower your left hand back to the floor, returning to Side Plank. Then, gently transition back to Downward-Facing Dog.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by transitioning into Side Plank on your left hand and lifting your right leg and hips into Wild Thing.

benefits: Strengthens the core, legs, and arms
Promotes flexibility and range of motion
Calms the mind and promotes relaxation
Promotes a sense of inner peace and well-being
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe knee injuries, high blood pressure, or glaucoma
Should be done with caution by pregnant women and people with neck or shoulder injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Tadasana (Mountain Pose)
steps.description: Begin by standing in Tadasana, with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Ground yourself firmly through both feet.

steps.name: Shift your weight to your right foot
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your right foot, grounding it firmly. Keep your left foot slightly lifted off the ground.

steps.name: Bend your left knee and bring your heel towards your buttocks
steps.description: Bend your left knee and bring your heel towards your buttocks. Reach your left hand behind your back and attempt to clasp your right hand behind your back.

steps.name: Maintain balance and alignment
steps.description: Maintain your balance and alignment as you continue to fold forward from your hips while keeping your hands bound behind your back.

steps.name: Fold forward and extend your left leg behind you
steps.description: Continue folding forward, extending your left leg behind you. Keep your chest close to your right thigh and maintain the bind with your hands.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Baddha Hasta Yoganidrasana for several breaths, focusing on deep and steady breathing. Keep your gaze forward or down to maintain balance.

steps.name: To release, slowly return to an upright position
steps.description: To release the pose, slowly return to an upright position, releasing the bind of your hands and lowering your left leg to the floor.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side
steps.description: Repeat the steps on the other side by shifting your weight to your left foot and binding your hands behind your back while folding forward and extending your right leg behind you.

precautions: Avoid practicing Dangling Pose if you are pregnant or have any injuries to your back, hips, or knees.
It is best to practice Dangling Pose under the guidance of a qualified yoga teacher.
Avoid forcing the pose if you are unable to touch your toes.

steps.name: Start in a Forearm Plank
steps.description: Begin by coming into a forearm plank position. Lower yourself onto your forearms with your elbows directly under your shoulders, fingers spread wide, and palms facing down.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your hips
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and lift your hips, creating an inverted V shape with your body. Your feet should be hip-width apart.

steps.name: Shift your weight forward onto your forearms
steps.description: Shift your weight forward onto your forearms while keeping your shoulders over your elbows. This is the preparation phase for Scorpion Pose.

steps.name: Begin to lift one leg toward the sky
steps.description: Start by lifting one leg off the ground and extending it upward toward the sky. Keep your toes pointed and your leg straight.

steps.name: Bend your lifted leg and reach it toward your head
steps.description: Bend the knee of your lifted leg and start to reach it overhead toward your head. Keep the other leg grounded on the floor for support.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your head off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and lift your head off the ground as you continue to lift the bent leg higher toward your head.

steps.name: Balance on your forearms and extend your bent leg
steps.description: Balance on your forearms while extending the bent leg upward, aiming to bring it over and beyond your head. Keep your chest open and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Scorpion Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and maintaining your balance. Keep your core engaged and avoid straining your neck.

steps.name: To release, lower your lifted leg and return to Forearm Plank
steps.description: Exhale as you lower your lifted leg and return to the Forearm Plank position. Rest for a moment in this pose before transitioning to other poses or releasing.

steps.name: Repeat on the other side if desired
steps.description: If you wish to practice Scorpion Pose on the other side, repeat the steps with the opposite leg as the lifting leg.

precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries, high blood pressure, or glaucoma
Should be done with caution by pregnant women
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in a kneeling position
steps.description: Begin by kneeling on the floor with your knees and feet together. Your big toes should touch, and your heels should be pointing slightly outward.

steps.name: Sit back on your heels
steps.description: Slowly sit back on your heels, keeping your spine straight. Place your hands on your thighs with your palms facing down.

steps.name: Keep your back straight and shoulders relaxed
steps.description: Maintain a straight and upright back. Keep your shoulders relaxed and your chest open.

steps.name: Rest your hands on your thighs
steps.description: Rest your hands on your thighs with your palms facing down. Your fingers can gently touch your thighs, or you can form a mudra with your hands.

steps.name: Sit in this posture and breathe deeply
steps.description: Sit in Thunderbolt Pose with your eyes closed and focus on your breath. Take deep, slow breaths, and maintain this pose for your meditation or pranayama practice.

steps.name: To release the pose, lean forward onto your hands and knees
steps.description: To exit the pose, gently lean forward onto your hands and knees, and then rise to a standing position if needed.

benefits: Calms the mind and reduces stress
Stabilizes the lower back and legs
Opens the hips, groin, and ankles
Promotes a sense of grounding and stability
precautions: If you have knee pain, you may want to place a folded blanket or bolster under your knees.
If you have any other injuries, please consult with your doctor before practicing this pose.

steps.name: Start in Mountain Pose
steps.description: Begin in Mountain Pose (Tadasana), standing straight with your feet together and arms at your sides.

steps.name: Shift your weight onto one foot
steps.description: Shift your weight onto your right foot, firmly planting it into the ground. Keep your left knee bent.

steps.name: Place your foot on your inner thigh
steps.description: Pick up your left foot and place the sole against your right inner thigh, as high as comfortable. Avoid placing your foot directly on your knee joint.

steps.name: Balance and align
steps.description: Press your foot into your thigh and your thigh back into your foot to create balance. Align your pelvis so that itâ€™s directly over your right foot.

steps.name: Bring your hands to your heart
steps.description: Bring your palms together in front of your chest in a prayer position. Find a fixed point in front of you to focus on for balance.

steps.name: Option to raise your arms
steps.description: If you feel stable, extend your arms above your head, keeping them either shoulder-width apart or palms touching.

steps.name: Hold the pose
steps.description: Hold the pose for several deep breaths, maintaining a steady gaze and even breathing. Stay in the pose for as long as comfortable.

steps.name: Release and repeat on the other side
steps.description: To release the pose, lower your arms and leg with control, returning to Mountain Pose. Repeat the same steps with the opposite leg.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the wrists, shoulders, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Tulasana
Start with a modified version of the pose if you are unable to balance on your hands

steps.name: Start in a comfortable seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting in a comfortable cross-legged or kneeling position on your yoga mat.

steps.name: Place your hands on your thighs or knees
steps.description: Rest your hands on your thighs or knees with your palms facing down. Ensure your spine is straight, and your shoulders are relaxed.

steps.name: Inhale deeply through your nose
steps.description: Take a deep breath in through your nose, filling your lungs completely.

steps.name: Exhale forcefully through your mouth
steps.description: As you exhale, open your mouth wide and stick out your tongue as far as it will go, while simultaneously making a 'ha' sound.

steps.name: Gaze at the space between your eyebrows
steps.description: As you exhale and stick out your tongue, focus your gaze at the space between your eyebrows (the 'third eye' point).

steps.name: Stretch your fingers wide
steps.description: While sticking out your tongue, stretch your fingers wide and fan them out, spreading your palms open.

steps.name: Roar like a lion
steps.description: During the exhale, produce a 'ha' sound resembling a lion's roar. Let go of any tension in your face, neck, and throat.

steps.name: Hold the pose for a few breaths
steps.description: Hold the Lion Pose for a few breaths, continuing to stretch your face, stick out your tongue, and release any pent-up tension.

steps.name: Release the pose and return to a neutral seated position
steps.description: Inhale and release the pose, bringing your tongue back inside your mouth and closing it. Return to a neutral seated position with your hands on your thighs or knees.

steps.name: Repeat the pose if desired
steps.description: You can repeat Lion Pose a few times, focusing on the breath and the release of facial tension.

benefits: Releases tension in the face, neck, and shoulders
precautions: Avoid practicing Lion Pose if you have a cold or sore throat.
Be mindful of your energy level and take breaks as needed.

steps.name: Start by lying face down on your yoga mat
steps.description: Lie down on your belly with your legs extended straight and your feet hip-width apart. Rest your forehead on your hands, crossing your arms at the elbows.

steps.name: Relax your shoulders and neck
steps.description: Allow your shoulders to relax away from your ears. Keep your neck in a neutral position, and soften the muscles in your face and jaw.

steps.name: Breathe deeply and consciously
steps.description: Take deep and conscious breaths, focusing on the rise and fall of your abdomen with each breath. Feel your belly pressing against the mat as you inhale and gently rising as you exhale.

steps.name: Relax your entire body
steps.description: As you continue to breathe deeply, consciously relax your entire body. Release any tension in your back, legs, and hips. Feel the support of the ground beneath you.

steps.name: Hold the pose and rest
steps.description: Hold Crocodile Pose for as long as you like, allowing your body to rest and rejuvenate. It's an excellent pose for relieving lower back discomfort and promoting relaxation.

steps.name: To release, gently roll onto your back
steps.description: When you're ready to come out of the pose, gently roll onto your back and take a moment to transition to your next posture or simply rest in Savasana (Corpse Pose).

benefits: Reduces tension in the back, neck, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries or neck pain.
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Crocodile Pose.
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose.

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on the floor or on a cushion in a comfortable cross-legged position. Ensure that your spine is upright and your shoulders are relaxed.

steps.name: Place your hands on your knees or thighs
steps.description: Rest your hands gently on your knees or thighs. Your palms can be facing up or down, depending on your preference and tradition.

steps.name: Close your eyes and maintain a relaxed posture
steps.description: Close your eyes and maintain a relaxed posture. Keep your back straight and your chin parallel to the floor. Allow your breath to become natural and unforced.

steps.name: Focus on your meditation or inner awareness
steps.description: Pendant Pose is typically used as a meditation posture. Use this time to turn your attention inward, focus on your breath, or engage in your chosen meditation practice.

steps.name: Hold the pose for your desired meditation duration
steps.description: Hold Pendant Pose for as long as you wish to meditate or maintain your inner awareness. It's essential to sit comfortably and without strain during your practice.

steps.name: To release the pose, gently open your eyes
steps.description: When you're ready to conclude your meditation or inner practice, gently open your eyes, take a few deep breaths, and slowly transition to another seated posture or standing position.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the wrists, shoulders, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Pendant Pose
Start with a modified version of the pose if you are unable to lift your legs off the ground

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting on your yoga mat with your legs extended straight in front of you.

steps.name: Open your legs
steps.description: Slowly open your legs as wide as comfortably possible, keeping them straight.

steps.name: Bend your knees slightly
steps.description: Bend your knees slightly and bring your arms under your knees from the inside. Extend your arms and shoulders as far as you can along the floor beneath your knees.

steps.name: Lower your torso
steps.description: Exhale and gently lower your torso forward and down, attempting to bring your chest and stomach as close to the floor as possible.

steps.name: Extend your legs
steps.description: Gradually straighten your legs as much as you can, aiming to rest your chest and chin on the floor between your legs. Your arms should remain extended under your knees, palms facing down.

steps.name: Relax into the pose
steps.description: Relax into the pose and hold it for a few breaths. Ensure that you maintain a steady, even breathing pattern.

steps.name: Release the pose
steps.description: To release the pose, slowly come back up, bringing your torso upright and withdrawing your arms. Gently draw your legs back together and return to a seated position.

benefits: Reduces tension in the back, neck, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries or neck pain
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Tortoise Pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Begin in Lotus Pose (Padmasana)
steps.description: Start by sitting in Lotus Pose with both legs crossed and your feet on your opposite thighs. Ensure that your spine is straight, and your hands are resting on your knees.

steps.name: Interlace your fingers behind your back
steps.description: Reach your arms behind your back and interlace your fingers, straightening your arms as much as possible. This action will help prepare your shoulders and chest.

steps.name: Inhale and lift your feet off the floor
steps.description: Inhale deeply, engaging your core muscles, and slowly lift both feet off the floor. Keep your legs in the Lotus position while balancing on your sitting bones.

steps.name: Exhale and draw your knees toward your chest
steps.description: As you exhale, draw your knees toward your chest while keeping your feet in Lotus. Your arms should be supporting your upper body, and your fingers remain interlaced behind your back.

steps.name: Round your spine and create a compact shape
steps.description: Continue to exhale and round your spine, creating a compact and rounded shape resembling an embryo in the womb. Keep your chin slightly tucked.

steps.name: Hold the pose and balance
steps.description: Maintain Garbha Pindasana for several breaths, finding your balance and stability in the compact position. Keep your core engaged and your breath steady.

steps.name: To release, slowly extend your legs and arms
steps.description: To exit the pose, slowly and carefully extend your legs, releasing the Lotus position. Straighten your arms and release the interlaced fingers.

steps.name: Return to Lotus Pose
steps.description: After extending your legs and arms, return to Lotus Pose for a moment to reset and prepare for your next posture or to finish your practice.

benefits: Calms the mind and nervous system
precautions: Not recommended for people with severe back injuries or neck pain
Wait until after 12 weeks of pregnancy to practice this pose
Warm up thoroughly before practicing this pose
Avoid overstretching or discomfort in the pose

steps.name: Start in Malasana (Garland Pose)
steps.description: Begin by squatting in Malasana, also known as Garland Pose. Bring your feet hip-width apart, bend your knees, and lower your hips toward the floor. Your feet should be flat on the ground, and your palms should be pressed together at your heart center in a prayer position.

steps.name: Shift your weight forward
steps.description: Shift your weight forward onto your toes and lift your hips higher, leaning slightly forward. This will create the momentum needed to transition into Bhujapidasana.

steps.name: Place your hands on the floor
steps.description: Place your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart, with your fingers spread wide. Keep your elbows slightly bent.

steps.name: Bend your elbows and bring your knees onto your upper arms
steps.description: Bend your elbows and carefully lift your feet off the ground. Begin to bring your knees onto your upper arms, as close to your armpits as possible.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your feet off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and use your arm strength to lift your feet off the ground. Keep your knees bent and your shins parallel to the floor.

steps.name: Balance in Bhujapidasana
steps.description: Balance in Bhujapidasana, finding stability in this arm balance. Keep your gaze forward and maintain your breath.

steps.name: To release, gently lower your feet to the ground
steps.description: To exit the pose, gently lower your feet back to the ground in Malasana, returning to the squatting position with your palms pressed together at your heart.

steps.name: Rest in Malasana or transition to other poses
steps.description: You can rest in Malasana for a moment or transition to other poses in your practice as needed.

benefits: Strengthens the core, arms, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the wrists, shoulders, or back
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Bhujapidasana
Start with a modified version of the pose if you are unable to balance on your hands

steps.name: Start in a tabletop position
steps.description: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position, with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.

steps.name: Slide your knees apart
steps.description: Slowly slide your knees apart, widening your stance until your knees are aligned with your hips. Your feet should be flexed with the soles facing up.

steps.name: Align your ankles with your knees
steps.description: Ensure that your ankles are in line with your knees. Your shins should be parallel to each other and pointing outward.

steps.name: Place your hands under your shoulders
steps.description: Place your hands under your shoulders, with your fingers pointing forward. Your elbows should be slightly bent.

steps.name: Press your hips back and down
steps.description: Press your hips back and down toward the floor, maintaining the alignment of your knees, ankles, and feet. Your chest should remain open.

steps.name: Lower your chest toward the ground
steps.description: Lower your chest and upper body toward the ground, aiming to bring your chest as close to the floor as comfortably possible. Keep your spine elongated.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Frog Pose for several breaths, breathing deeply and allowing your hips to gently open. You may feel a deep stretch in your groin and hips.

steps.name: To release, lift your chest and slide your knees back together
steps.description: To come out of the pose, lift your chest, engage your core, and carefully slide your knees back together, returning to the tabletop position.

steps.name: Rest in Child's Pose
steps.description: After releasing Frog Pose, you can rest in Child's Pose for a few breaths to relax your hips and lower back.

precautions: Not recommended for people with severe hip or knee injuries
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Frog Pose
Listen to your body and don't force yourself into the pose if you experience pain

steps.name: Start in a seated position
steps.description: Begin by sitting in a comfortable seated position on your yoga mat with your legs extended straight in front of you.

steps.name: Bend your knees and bring your feet close to your buttocks
steps.description: Bend your knees and bring your feet close to your buttocks, keeping your knees hip-width apart. Place your hands on the floor behind your hips with your fingers pointing forward.

steps.name: Lift your hips off the ground
steps.description: Press through your hands and lift your hips off the ground. Your weight should be supported by your hands and feet, with your knees bent at approximately 90 degrees.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and start to lift your legs off the ground, bringing your knees toward your chest. Keep your chest open and your gaze forward.

steps.name: Extend your legs straight up towards the sky
steps.description: Continue to lift your legs, extending them straight up toward the sky. Your thighs should be parallel to the floor, and your legs should be as straight as possible.

steps.name: Balance in Ganda Bherundasana
steps.description: Balance in Ganda Bherundasana, maintaining your core engagement and focus. Your weight should be balanced on your hands, and your legs should be perpendicular to the floor.

steps.name: Hold the pose for a few breaths
steps.description: Hold Ganda Bherundasana for several breaths, focusing on your breath and maintaining stability in the pose.

steps.name: To release, lower your legs and hips to the ground
steps.description: To come out of the pose, slowly lower your legs and hips back to the ground. Extend your legs and return to a seated position.

steps.name: Rest and transition to other poses
steps.description: Take a moment to rest and transition to other poses in your practice as needed. Ganda Bherundasana is a challenging pose, so listen to your body and practice safely.

benefits: Strengthens the core, back, and shoulders
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the neck, back, shoulders, or wrists
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Formidable Pose
Start with a modified version of the pose if you are unable to maintain the full form

steps.name: Begin in a kneeling position
steps.description: Start by kneeling on your yoga mat with your knees hip-width apart. Place your forearms on the ground in front of you with your elbows directly under your shoulders.

steps.name: Clasp your hands and form a triangle with your forearms
steps.description: Clasp your hands together and create a triangle shape with your forearms by pressing your pinky fingers and forearms into the floor. Your hands should be shoulder-width apart.

steps.name: Place the crown of your head on the ground
steps.description: Lower the crown of your head onto the floor between your forearms. Your head should rest on the floor with your neck in a neutral position.

steps.name: Lift your hips and walk your feet toward your elbows
steps.description: Lift your hips off your heels and begin to walk your feet toward your elbows. Keep your toes on the ground for support as you approach the forearm stand position.

steps.name: Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground
steps.description: Engage your core muscles and start to lift your legs off the ground. Keep your legs bent at the knees, and your heels should move toward your buttocks.

steps.name: Extend your legs upward
steps.description: Continue to lift your legs upward, extending them straight toward the ceiling. Your body should form an inverted 'V' shape.

steps.name: Arch your back and lift your chest
steps.description: Arch your back and lift your chest upward, creating a backbend in the pose. Keep your gaze forward, and your shoulders should be stacked over your elbows.

steps.name: Hold the pose and breathe deeply
steps.description: Hold Formidable Face/Chin Stand Pose for a few breaths, maintaining balance and control. Breathe deeply and evenly to help stabilize the pose.

steps.name: To release, lower your legs and return to the kneeling position
steps.description: To come out of the pose, lower your legs with control and return to the kneeling position. Rest for a moment before transitioning to other poses or taking a well-deserved break.

benefits: Strengthens the core, back, shoulders, arms, and wrists
Improves flexibility in the spine, shoulders, and hamstrings
precautions: Not recommended for beginners or people with injuries to the neck, back, shoulders, wrists, or head
Warm up thoroughly before practicing Formidable Face/Chin Stand Pose
Start with a modified version of the pose if you are unable to maintain the full form
Have a spotter available when practicing for the first time
